64s1rSEwA-4_u-lvSXYfZA.text: Wow !!!  What a joke.  We ordered for the first time from this place based on Yelp reviews...Never again.  The food looks great, but they didn't give us anything to eat it with.  When I called, the guy hardly spoke English and told me you have to pay extra for forks.  Are you serious ????  What horrible service.

6eJoKon89zzgz91Bkr_Csw.text: Great Italian deli. Recommend the Chicago Italian hot sandwich.  Also tried the cheesecake and seafood salad.  Place has an assortment of great deli meats and Italian groceries. Handmade sausage also delicious.

209sVIm6hXmD7wgVIphChg.text: There are a lot of places in Phoenix Metro where you can get a good Italian sub, but only a handful where you can score a great Italian sub. Guido's is one of them.  Their subs, hot or cold, are some of the best in the area. I say this tongue in cheek, mainly because if you're from New York or Philly you'll disagree with my 'great' assessment. But do try to keep in mind this is the desert.  Where we don't have decent breads unless the deli is buying local from MJ or Arizona Bread Company, which they typically don't. The cold cuts are Boar's heads and not imported.  And the tomatoes are desert tomatoes, not Jersey sweets.  So there IS a difference, you're right NY and Philly, but once you get off your high horse and figure out there aren't a whole lot of places to choose from here, you'll eat Guido's and you'll like it goddammit. Ughhh.    I visit here regularly to restock my fridge with fresh olives, imported provolone, and Margherita pepperoni, one of the few places that has it. They also have decent homemade biscotti and pizzelles. Their homemade sausage is tasty too. Not the best, just tasty.  If you often find yourself eating at any of the chain sub shops around town, give yourself a break from the insufferable shit they call 'Italian' and try Guido's.   Guido's. Where in light of everything, easier (and cheaper) than a trip to New York, Philly, or Atlantic City.

0DL-6Lg9bDVFp31XpwguTw.text: The food is pretty good but not any better than other Italian delis in the area.  Service is horrible and it's complete Chaos in there.  Nobody knows what is going on.  Took more than 30 minutes to get out of there with a simple salad and soup order...  AND, they got the salad wrong.  Was the third order in a row they got wrong while I was there and they didn't seem to care.  Do yourself a favor and avoid the aggravation and spend your money somewhere else.

VwqAYqofdMlMlDYNXmwqmQ.text: Background: I've had their food 3 separate times but finally made it in there for an on site visit on Saturday. (they deliver and have takeout).    Food: The first time I had their sandwich at a friends place it was a mozzarella and prosciutto conglomeration of epic amazing awesomeness.  Then when I found out the Chicago connection (as I'm from Chicago) even more cool points awarded.    Second time, I wanted to try their entrees, so I fired up the pesto gnocchi with shrimp and that too was delicious! The shrimp was fresh tasting and gnocchi cooked to perfection. Large portions too! There were like 8 shrimp!   Ambiance: Third time went in and fired up another prosciutto and mozzarella sammy and checked the place out. So it's setup like this.  Part store where you can buy all things Italian food, then a deli counter with all types of options (Italian meats, chicken salad, etc), then a counter where you order off menu for to go orders, and then also a sit down restaurant area with a server.  The got it covered!  They have a tv in there and it's totally casual.  I did see some white wine in a fridge that you could likely buy if you wanted to drink it there but didn't see red wine, but I'm sure it's there!    Service:  The service was great, the gentleman who took my order was very sociable and my sandwich came up very promptly.    Overall: Major thumbs up and a high five. If you are ever in the area I'd highly recommend this awesome place!

mYPG6ceNrkIad7IexsafSw.text: Typical Italian deli. Fresh and tasty. Seafood salad is a winner. Also their Broasted Chicken is very good. Service can be spotty at lunchtime. However dinner service is much better.

QBcC8pwxfXayb4-4PZt08A.text: This place is located along a grocery store strip mall. It's a little hard to find because it's tucked in on the inside corner. That doesn't seem to deter people though. This place has been busy serving customers for the past 28 years. I had no idea they'd been there that long. Geesh, they must be doing something right.   I've only tried a couple of things. By far, my favorite is their Italian sub. It's a freshly baked submarine roll absolutely stuffed with deli meats (salami and mortadella, pepperoni) and provolone cheese, then lettuce, tomato, onion, with a generous amount of Italian dressing poured over it. I know I should only order the half portion, but sometimes I just gotta go for the whole. Roll up your sleeves and get the napkins ready. You're in for a fantastic, messy, tasty treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Italian sub - roll up your sleeves and dig in.
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tasty spaghetti with sausage.

_cihg1Os6zN7byV9BcGMfw.text: I live in Scottsdale most of the year (except summer) and this place is a favorite for the locals. They're pizza is good, fresh and made from scratch. Family-owned and operated, good service and a deli/market is also there. I buy cheeses and meats there to use at home when I cook Italian (my heritage as well). Very cozy, long-time established place. Love the cheesecake too. They also have hilarious tees you can purchase...good place to dine casually.

c4gLNVhz_n-xEvmJocRr-w.text: Outstanding, outstanding, outstanding. Happened across this place on Urbanspoon - for some reason it wasn't showing up on Yelp. What a hidden gem! Authentic Italian food and atmosphere. This really is a trip to Chicago hidden in a shopping center.   Upon entering we were enthusiastically greeted by the owner, who must have overheard us talking about getting an Italian Beef, and pitched us a turkey sub with fries special he had going on. I got the turkey sub, my husband got the Italian beef.  Service was outstanding. Our food was out within 10 minutes of ordering and our waitress was very attentive. The owner came and inspected our dishes after they were served and joked with us briefly.   Our only regret is we are only in town from the Midwest for one day and can't come back every single day for something different! We will make this a place we come back to every time we are out here now though!

36NXRjiQWu2PlpI232djqQ.text: Terrible service, very slow... Food was tasteless, how can you ruin a Shrimp Parm hero ??? This is why New York is so much better than Chicago style.. Would not recommend this place to anyone!!!

3st4r-y1-ofb8I6h9YkAAA.text: Really great food and super nice staff!  Love the grocery and how fresh and delicious every dish is, yummy desserts too!!!  Plus, they cater to Atkins and healthy dishes too!

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing ravioli, minestrone and healthy salad options too!  All homemade fresh!!!

2lHrXqrKVjRgMZ8QQ_nGew.text: My boyfriend and I were on the hunt for Double Zero flour to make fresh pasta, and were very happy to find it at Guido's. This place is packed with almost every Italian treat you can imagine, and the prices were very reasonable. They also have a deli where they serve fresh food and sandwiches - we would definitely come back for lunch on another visit to Phoenix!

5jtC9dHQzSkOe-7uBOnHpA.text: We had a great dinner at Guido's.  the pasta was homemade, the prices reasonable, and the food very flavorful.  All of this in a deli market setting.  Two thumbs up.

RTp2y_8tM233-PwKBjWukg.text: Horrible service. Searched for some Italian delis in the valley. I wanted something I am accustomed to from back east and in the Midwest. Everything looked good to go online with this place so I headed out. Walked in and 3 different employees walked past us and not even a smile or can I help you. Granted, they seemed to be serving on the restaurant side, still it's a bad customer experience. Finally, walking back and forth the sandwich area and deli, different employees saw us and still didn't ask if we needed anything. I finally had to walk by the serving station and ask if we could et some help by the deli case. The woman said "oh, you want something"... So when she came to the deli we asked how much the mortadella was a pound and she just rattled off a price and that was it. We literally walked out.  This is a bummer that the service sucked because we were ready to buy about 5 different meats, cheese, olives, bread and cannoli shells along with some Pollyo and would have been return customers because the place looked great and quality was on point just looking at it. Price, doesn't matter in this equation because I will (as most will) pay for quality.  Please also keep in mind that this was not at dinner time, it was about 330 pm so perhaps they were on boarding the evening wait staff, but again, no excuse for not acknowledging people.  This bums me out more than anything because this place has the potential to be slam packed and it's not a wannabe Italian deli either, it's legit.  I will be back for another try, hopefully this was an off day.

PNXb72SDIA3q7uFnndOP8A.text: I have eaten at Guido's several times over the past few years and was always impressed with the food, but not so much with the service. Just recently, we visited again and we were so DISGUSTED with how bad the service was that we didn't even stay and eat this time.  For example, the waitress never came to our table initially. We had to go the front of the restaurant to try and place an order. This did not work, as we were told to go back and sit down and wait some more. I must also say that as we were waiting in line, the owner, I  presume, ignored us and spoke with some customers behind us in line, putting their orders in immediately.   So, in the end, we waited a bit more at our table and then got up and left. Even though the service has tended to be slow and rather inattentive in the past, we have never experienced this level of rudeness before. We will not be back.

zBvTYJgYP32-z_Wyc5bPvA.text: Guido's is awesome! I came in not expecting Chicago food and left full and surprised that the food tastes just like it does in Chicago. I had the Chicago roast beef sub and it was great. This hoagie roll was loaded with hot roast beef, peppers, and onions along with some dipping sauce. I will definitely be going back to this place when I am in town again.

Ict8CJXxHkKd6hreTEIu0Q.text: Absolutely the best broasted chicken in Phoenix.  5 star service and quality of food Cooked to order Tasty, not greasy chicken, very moist 4 piece meal will fill up the hungriest man Comes with nice dinner salad  My new go to place for chicken in town. Thanks

9zEjMj9-pqAOmw9FTECsEQ.text: Our first visit to Guido's we ordered an Italian Roast Beef sandwich and lasagna. The sandwich was served on Guido's bread complete with peppers and au jus. The dinner portion of lasagna was served with garlic bread and a very fresh Side salad with house dressing ( Italiian, of course). The lasagna was covered with a rich creamy bolognese. The ricotta was fluffy and light. The service was excellent. I purchased a pack of Bolocca Crema Latte wafers for dessert. We will go back again with upcoming guests.

MUVX9CqdVB8OwfhhWcfQvQ.text: This was one of the worst experiences of my entire restaurant going life! We waited 10minutes at our booth table before we were greeted and given menus!  We waited another 10 minutes to order. Then, we waited another 25 minutes for our food= 45 minutes!!! We ordered a seafood salad and an eggplant parm sandwhich!!! 2- 5 minutes total to prep these and the pkace was only about 1/2 full, maybe 6 tables of people with only 2 tables of us without food. The owner and manager were sitting in the back yapping and only 3 staff members working with 2 making food. When I inquired for the 2nd time where our food was, it came out. The salad for $13.99 was a smsll dinner salad in a large bowl apable of holding salad dor 4 people that was literally like a child's portion with 6 pieces of calamari on cut up lettuce with 3 thin pieces of yellow pepper pieces only, compared to one giant sized for  a little old lady sitting behind me. The "whole" large eggplant parm Sandwhich fir $10.99 was literally 2/3 the size of a subway footlong, hence about 8-9 in long.!! It had a 1- 2" spec piece of eggplant on one half with a glob of cheese and a ton of sauce. The other half had a 3" piece like the other. The bread was almost burnt too!! I complained about the salad and they took it back and added about a 1/2 cup of Mir salad and nothing else! When the sandwhich came out just after I complained about that too. The waiter said he would have the mgr/owner come over and did nothing else! Over 5 minutes went buy ad the mgr was talking with a staff member and didn't come over. My wife and I walked out without eating spending almost an hour total in this place. Talk about the worst service, food and atmosphere. The could care less!!! Now, we will tell the 100's of people we know which will turn into 1000's in our in our social circles not to go there nor do business with them. They hould be ashamed!!! They deserve to go out of business!!!

wWxBJ6YQ0h9jrKv7uvfetQ.text: When I first saw this place I actually called my boyfriend to ask: "Is this it?!" For a strip mall restaurant that doesn't look like much from the outside this place is surprisingly delightful on the inside. The walls are covered with fun decor and newspaper articles while any available surface space offers baked goods, t-shirts, cookies, and snacks. The best part about this place was the server. Robbie was no doubt the most pleasant server I've had in YEARS and I eat out all the time. He accommodated several special requests and was friendly & funny without being over-the-top or annoying. He didn't even seem irritated when my boyfriend and I started spatting across the table. Seriously Robbie, I would open a restaurant myself just to hire you. I guess I should also mention that the food was great! I will definitely be back the next time my boyfriend and I feel like fighting over some good food.

TZWGRtGi13CR2x_gI9xYNw.text: Short Story-  Italian Grocery Store, Deli and Market - Very Good   Italian Hoagie - above average and very good   House made hot Italian sausage sandwich- ok would have been very good if sausage wasn't overcooked. Peppers were cooked nicely and bread was good. Fresh basil was a nice touch.  Broasted Chicken- Unseasoned, dry meat. Horrible. Came with tasty potatoes and an average salad and pedestrian garlic toast.  Service- above average  Restroom- NONE so don't even think about refills.  Additional Notes-  Broasted chicken is suppose to be a juicier chicken with a crispy exterior that's more healthy than deep fried chicken. Broasted Chicken is made by a pressure cooker/fryer. The chicken is suppose to be marinated first and then battered. I don't know what was done here but it seemed like chicken out of the freezer that got thrown in a microwave, dipped in flour without seasoning. As the chicken sat on my plate it continued to dry even more. Maybe the regular crew wasn't on and I got the newbie cook or dishwasher filling in to prepare food.  I am generously averaging this review to a positive three stars because overall it was mostly positive and just a bad day for broasted chicken.

Their sammies are for sure huge, either share with a friend or get a half. They don't have a lot of tables so I think most people just do carry out. I also noticed some outdoor seating and people bringing their pups to the patio :) Also I'm pretty sure all their market goods are imported or homemade which is really unique niche if you think about it.

xO0jNSmyukVhRqD0wpi_mA.text: I'd give Guidos 10 stars if I could. This is real deal back east Italian food. If you are from Chicago or the east coast this place will feel like home cooking. Great food great service great environment. I can't  say enough about it. Drop what you're doing and treat yourself. Don't forget to take some canollis home!

lSAA2fVgmBCdU1ICDMjTaA.text: How have I lived here for so long and not realized this was here?   Little Italian grocery and restaurant with the nicest people working here!   Ravioli, chicken parm, cheesecake.... yum!!!

nwMHIVxCnPc0HHTq75bAEg.text: I am a Long time customer - Resturant offers homemade cooked food and from scratch .. Resturant is family owned and operated not a chain Resturant- worth the trip and money!! Owner is often working and in the store to see hello and supervises his staff. Broasted fish and chicken are excellent when you fall off the diet.  Many good Italian dishes and pizza is good too. Excellent cold cuts and cheeses and utilizing bread.

z6-eeaI8YOWDIA3gHjAjeg.text: FANTASTIC food! Haven't had Italian food this good since leaving the northeast 5 years ago. Highly recommend!

dtWDNyMgnjolqrFIgytyOA.text: This is a great hole on the wall.   I adore places like this that have great food, service and a nice atmosphere- it's a little store and restaurant.   I had one of their great pastas and my wife had the chicken parmigiana. Both were lovely with a nice salad and table bread.     It's one of those throw back places that serves southern Italian classics.  So don't go expecting something else and you won't be disappointed

pQYb-CivG2NVVQ7XKNyWog.text: Found Guido's on YELP while my wife was getting her hair done. Oh My God, what a wonderful find. We walked in and I just couldn't stop smiling. It's like I got on a plane and flew back east. It is truly a Deli where you can buy all kinds of meats and cheeses, fresh Mozzarella made in house, they cure their own meats, and in the middle of the deli they put tables and booths. This is a full Italian Restaurant. The vibe is amazing. There is a hustle and bustle of the place that is only found back east. The staff are very friendly, and the service was perfect. Some wrote about long waits for food. All I can say is I did not experience this and food was coming fast and furious to the other tables as well. I had Veal Parmesan. Once in a while I'll order it hoping to find a place that can match what I would get back east. I'm alway disappointed, well until now. They hit the bullseye. The veal was tender, but not hammered down  as thin as a piece of paper. This veal was hammered and tenderized, but left thick enough that it had a great mouth feel. It was a large veal cutlet, lightly breaded, cooked perfectly. The spaghetti you get with it was perfectly cooked al dente, and the sauce was delicious. Coming with a salad and garlic bread, it was really enough for two, but I'd have to chop your hand off it you tried to take some. I finished the whole thing. My wife had Spaghetti in white clam sauce. It also was perfectly cooked, and tasted great. We are definitely coming back, and if you haven't gone here, and love home style old school Italian, you need to go. It's worth any length of drive.

u_0S4HgQTQHXv12zR9i2bg.text: Great family owned place to eat AND take out -  try the meatballs. They are heavenly!

RsizEf-rSYY1jXlnnqQ6Bw.text: Food quality and service is not the same as it used to be. I used to love coming here...Not anymore, such a shame... there are so many places to chose from. Ristorante Giuseppe, 13610 N Scottsdale Rd, Scottsdale, AZ 85254 is amazing and they care!

You don't find that in Scottsdale much these days.  Fun deli style ambience.  Full service and service was excellent!  We will be back many, many times and with friends!!  Loved it!

m0GUlb_MZOxW5PX1E-_gSA.text: Took my son to Guido's today for lunch.  He had the meatball hero and I had the veal parm hero.  Both were very good.  Sauce was salty and garlicy, veal was clearly pounded and tender service was right on and the atmosphere was perfectly 'jointy'.  As a tip, buy some of their fresh mozarella.  Simply delicious.

7Q9Udf3VTD_I1W7ABkMpaQ.text: Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. We have been in countless times and never had a bad meal. We have gotten take out, food to go to prepare at home, and eaten here. The wings and calamari are our favorite appetizers on the menu. Anything on the menu is excellent from the best ceasar salad, the chicken parm sub, spaghetti and meatballs, are all some of our all time favorite entree's. Just tried the cannoli for the first time yesterday and it was probably the best cannoli I've ever had. One of the best restaurants in the valley.

7YfMaj5R8cvZfIyJrfRUdw.text: Just so so.... had the pesto ravioli it was tasteless. Hot sandwich pastrami was pretty good. Ordered a pizza to go.... $24 gets you four or five pieces of sausage barely any cheese and  doey crust. Everything totaled $70 they are so winning!!

1LJtnS4Ycfy0zHcvkevdJA.text: I saw this restaurant/deli highlighted on 'Check Please! Arizona' and was compelled to come for dinner with my very good friend. It is a spacious deli with several tables available where servers take care of your order. When you walk in you are welcomed by the Italian grocery on the right and the deli counter on your left. If you're ordering to go, you walk straight up the the counter to place your order - we weren't sure of the protocol, so went up to order when we met Joe Guido himself and learned that for dinner service you seat yourself. Joe's voice is just as delicious in person as it was in the interview on 'Check Please! Arizona!' :). We were there relatively early on a Saturday (around 6pm) so found a table after a few min and the line formed out the door.   We ordered the antipasto misto appetizer, chicken piccata, chicken marsala and 2 pieces of breasted chicken. Joe treated us each to a cannoli. The antipasto plate was delicious - definitely good for sharing. The chicken piccata was very good - I subbed vegetables for pasta and my friend had the chicken marsala which was generously portioned - she could only manage half. I really enjoyed the belated chicken leg...so crispy and flavorful on the outside and juicy on the inside. Neither of us had room for cannoli, so that will be breakfast!  We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Stacy and me with Joe.

dhzEVlxk4TLJT3pxnY4vhA.text: The rating keeps plummeting here at Guido's as does the quality of food. The last chicken parmesan I had here was pretty epic, but now they are breading small strips of chicken (not a full cutlet) and dumping it on their bread with not enough cheese and too big of a roll. They are generous with the parsley. Also, they need to find cooks who understand English better or have someone American taking my order. I clearly said I want half a sandwich to the Mexican cook, yet I got a full sandwich instead. Since I thought it would be a good hero I shook it off, but guess what, the joke was on me in the end.

IZmj6y8OFEqCCzyXsVYORg.text: Love this spot!  Grew up nearby and never checked it out until I was much older and no longer lived nearby, wish I would have known about it sooner because I've been missing out! Guidos gives you the genuine Italian deli feel you wouldn't expect in AZ and their top notch Italian eats transport you.  Haven't had a chance to try everything on the menu, but what I can say is everything I have had is perfection!  The servings are large and the prices are fair.  Also, don't forget dessert, they have some genuine Spumoni and decadent cannolis that'll have you rolling out the door.  Bon appetit!

Q_v35EmPdGVyC9lxtCjLWw.text: Decent Chicago/New York style Italian deli - their meatballs are great, I wish I'd ordered a whole meatball sandwich.  We tried the broasted chicken and potatoes which were pretty delicious, but as far as fried chicken (or close to it) goes it isn't anything to rave about.  Overall, definitely would go back but it's hanging onto 4 rating by a fingernail.

gkhQKfe8UHJ6PnkKI9PBWw.text: Food is outstanding, but don't expect amazing service.  Freshest calamari I've had in a while.  The server we had was was not good about simple things.  For example, we had to ask for plates for our starter item, which was brought out without any forks or knives. She made three separate trips back and forth from our table just for the starter.  Before taking our drink orders she took drink orders from a table which was seated after us.  It was very noticeable.  I'm not sure if the service follies were intentional or just because she wasn't a good server.  She was outwardly nice - just not efficient.       I like that there are some authentic grocery items available for purchase as well.  Generally a good place.  Like the rating says, my overall experience was "A-OK."

3EMe2qRDYwR0hxdgK0pspw.text: Soooo I've been at this place for over an hour with my family.... Worst service I've had in quite some time. I hope the foods good

MrHTQK04YiiVakR6c4CNCg.text: Excellent authentic Italian food made from scratch.  We always enjoy the friendly atmosphere created by the staff.  Love the spaghetti & meatballs!  Be sure to finish your meal with spumoni direct from Italy!

pD05BNShZyF9g_W5p_D7Qw.text: Picked up sandwiches from Guido's Deli one night. Although I wasn't with my husband when he picked up the order, he commented on how good the service was. I had the Italian Sub with Capocollo, Mortadella and Salami. It was a good sandwich...huge and loaded with meat! I couldn't finish it. Everyone in our group enjoyed their sandwich as well, but they were so big that we all ended up having leftovers for lunch the following day. We also ordered cannolis and although they were small, they were awesome!! Sweet, but not too sweet, with a delicious filling and mini chocolate chips. I love cannolis!

P1bLE1rrHlU5XNhHebApeQ.text: Introduced our family to Guidos last night for my husbands birthday. We've been to Guidos MANY times and have noticed the last several times we have not been happy with the food and especially the service. Each time we've gone there are new servers which explains, but certainly doesn't not excuse,  the bad service. My husband had the veal piccata which he said was burned and not tender, and the pasta side was not cooked and the sauce was bland. My daughter had the linguine with shrimp and was disappointed the shrimp was not grilled, but deep fried (this should be noted in the description). Sadly we will probably not waste our time driving an hour for this restaurant.

fIuECmfwPr2rLMLiKqvA-A.text: We used to love this place. It's gone to hell. Ordered a sandwich today and it came out incorrect three times while the rest of my party finished their meal. The food has taken a turn towards cost cutting I think. Quality has suffered. Too bad....It was a favorite.

_ThBQQ1G77itQs-_0-c2Zg.text: Great service. Friendly. Delicious food. We heard of the restaurant from the show on PBS's Check Please, Arizona. We tried it and out and were not disappointed.

Gs3CBUvGlE5slEKUXkqO9A.text: It was the first time I tried this Italian deli.  Since it is holiday time I am always looking for an Italian store where I can buy groceries to prepare Italian meals.  I bought Pastosa frozen ravioli, sausage and cookies.  When I opened the box of ravioli many of them were cracked meaning they were old!  It was late Sunday evening the 17th of Dec.  I was disgusted but anxious to get a meal on the table.  I heard Pastosa pasta is very well respected in Brooklyn and NJ.  Having Italian roots I was excited to taste them.  Most of them opened up and the filling poured out.  We scraped up what we could.  I am a teacher and it was a busy week for me.  I finally had a chance to bring in the receipt with the box of empty ravioli.  The Asian mgr or owner came out and asked me what the date was on the receipt, how I cooked them and gave me the third degree.  All I wanted was to get another box of ravioli. She said I should have called her right away or taken a picture, therefore I get no money back and no exchange. Would I have driven all the way to Scottsdale to complain about something that didn't happen?  Fact is they were old and she didn't want to admit it.  Rude and poor customer service, I'll never set foot in that place again.  Reminds me of how they treat customers who complain in Hong Kong.  I'm going to write the pasta company to complain.

vrlZFTQOD_gkT4EGev5cBg.text: Being from Chicago, I wanted to try this place out. Saw some less than great Yelp reviews and wasn't sure we should go. Decided to try it and showed up Saturday night with 7 people. Very busy, but they put two tables together in a couple minutes and we were seated. Immediately someone had to use the bathroom and I remembered a review that said they did not have one. That is NOT correct, they have bathrooms. So a busy restaurant with a table of 7 and we all wanted to try something, but wanted changes to almost everything. This was no problem and everything we ordered came out fairly quickly and correctly. Guido delivered some of the dishes and wanted to know where we were putting everything. Told him we wanted to try everything and we would do it family style. He even offered to split them in the kitchen but we just had him put everything in the middle of the table. We had pasta with homemade sausage, salads, pizza, and broasted chicken. Everything was very good. Not the best pizza in the valley but in the top 10. Sausage was perfect. For desert, the huge chocolate cake and cannoli's (pistachio and chocolate chip). A small fight broke out at the end for who was going to get the last bites. Service was great. Very friendly. We will be back. Guido came outside when we left and asked how everything was and to thank us for coming in. Nice touch.

mDMQMTjy-o4ZudNV12KXEw.text: I am a HUGE fan of this place, I go often, and not only do I love the food but I HIGHLY recommend others to go there.  I don't want to write a big, long boring play by play...  But here is what I CAN tell you:  The owner is from Chicago (Hence the name!) He is ALWAYS there, and greets everyone and is super nice.  Every single thing I have ever ordered there is DELISH.  I have not had a single complaint, or been disappointed even once.  Their sandwiches, particularly the eggplant parm and the chicken parm are incredible.  Amazing crusty bread with a huge portion, they don't skimp.  Their sauce is outstanding as well. The meatballs are phenomenal. I am also a fan of their minestrone soup.  I have gone there just for that.  its hearty, needs absolutely nothing sprinkled on or added to it.  And they are consistent.  Always good, every time.  I am actually salivating as I type this review LOL.  Seriously though, if you haven't tried it, please go.  It's a casual, friendly environment, and the food is outstanding, I don't care who you are, Italian or not.  (Although, it IS an Italian import store as well and their cheeses and bread are amaze balls!)

zmChJavquuBMfumYEQMZUw.text: There is one reason, that sticks out like a sore thumb why I have them 5 stars.  THEY HAVE MARGARITA BRAND PEPPERONI!!! Seriously this is like the only place in town I could find it. When I walked in and saw "Boars Head" brand I was really irritated that an Italian specialty grocery store would sell Safeway grade deli meats. But then I asked and they had it. So amp'ed.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Storefront. Always good to know what the place looks like

t8he9soIhRXX4BaHXRztwA.text: This place is a great authentic Chicago style deli but also serves hot pastas as well as many other treats. Has been here for a very long time and if you go in you will find out why.

HWfjF0zCeKwG09y3WUVXIw.text: 2nd visit in less than a week. Some minor issues each time but the food is so damn good that we will keep coming back.

zY7r1Vdo4P93w3YObPRUbQ.text: Guidos broasted chicken rocks as do their broasted potatoes. The Italian dishes are awesome too. Go there,  you won't regret it. They also have a wonderful take home deli.

um_7ah2di54dAAUkc-ncNA.text: Interesting!  Old school Chicago Italian decorated place. The service is a bit slow.  The food is not good just looks good.  I guess this place went down.

p4qBQNJE1Kn20-yNo2PiHA.text: Second visit to Guido's. Excellent broasted chicken! Actually too much food! Our server Kendra was very personable and very attentive. She's great! Worth the 2.5 hour one-way trip to Guido's!

F__IzOCjxuIIRe0T7HnmCw.text: We went out to have a family dinner at guidos deli after Watching "CHECK PLEASE". Well we order the 2 plates broasted chicken and wedge potato and we recieced cole slaw was watery and very very sweet. we also got the pototoe salad it also was very very sweet to hard for me to each since i am diabetic .The Broasted chicken was very very dry and the pototoe wedges was very wet and soggy on the inside and fried on out side was not very good.We also had the pepproni pizza blan no taste.Husband order the caesar salad it was simple just alot lettues and some hot chicken on top and to much vinegar and water for dressing .He did not like it .We also order the gnocchi with a red sauce that was good but little blan for me.all and all I was disappointed with my order.They are very over price for the quality of food they put out .We paid $80.22 for our order last night 01/24/2017 we arrived at 9:20pm.Maybe the food is alot better early in the day I don't know .We wasted all the food it was like a taste test .We where still hungry when we left. Well I return again .I'm afraid not.My kids love to eat ... First time they did not like restaurant food.Customer service was great.

qv83JnPz5bYc7juRuvBiyw.text: Been coming in for years and love this place! The owner is always behind the cash register and good for a couple belly laughs. Oh, and the food is simply perfect! From the breasted chicken to the meatball park sub you are gonna want it all and take some home too. Be sure to come around Christmas for the HUGE table of amazing baked treats! Just love this place!

bWRatz81WagO-G7J_YPvgw.text: I just left Guido's and I was ROBBED!!! I ordered 2lbs of Italian sausage @$ 5.99 a pound which I didn't have a problem with.   The real problem is my ordered a whole Italian Sub @ $ 11.99  I asked them to substitute the mortadella for ham which is ham also.   The check came and this place is nothing but a rip-off they charged $2.50 for the ham which was substituted . The sandwich was all soggy from the dressing and it fell apart.   I purchased 1/3 pound of imported provolone @ $12.79  This place has been ripping people off for many years and people are just stupid to return there.   For the Owner Joe Guido he is the biggest scumbag in Scottsdale and enjoys seeing his customers getting ripped off.    I would stay away from this scam joint..   if you want a Italian sandwich and great pizza try DEL FRANCO'S in Scottsdale on Scottsdale road and you won't get ROBBED!!     Guido's is nothing but a  rip off and the owner is behind it obviously !!!!!!   Stay away from this place!!!

0VfsjEtDURtJ0etiO7VGaQ.text: Best sub I've had in Arizona! Get a warm sub with salami, pepperoni, and ham!

WZD7rqN78L34IzISreVbZQ.text: This place is the real deal. At any given time you can find this place fully seated and people standing in line to grab their food to-go. If you aren't Italian like myself, you'll soon finding yourself wishing you were. They have a full deli with homemade meats and sides that make you think of family and comfort. It's a little loud but that's one of the things I love about it. Run by a family that puts their all into, what more could you ask for. The subs are my favorite but I haven't had anything here I didn't like. Makes me miss Chicago, but luckily I have this place to come to. Don't miss out on this gem!

06Xa6-f-45UF_kjaQwGxqg.text: It's rare to find authentic delis in AZ, whether it's Chicago or otherwise, but this one is defintely a gem tucked away in a complex. Friendly service and welcoming atmosphere with plenty of deli products for purchase. Ordered the Chicago Roast Beef sandwich and was not disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Deli roast beef melt with peppers and onions on a classic italian bun with a side of amazing dipping sauce.

K-uUixfTgPvi5wdiD_Kf5w.text: Their braised chicken is very enjoyable. Comes with two sides, and bread. Best coleslaw in town. Great service

eZRnlJ1cVMvptiy3_9FpFQ.text: Amazing!!!!! I was craving Italian and stopped in this gem alone for dinner. I was initially going to order to go, but the hospitality I received made me dine in. The manager Manny greeted me warmly and offered me their featured wine. He made recommendations and told me some history of the restaurant. I ordered mostaccioli al forno with meatballs! It comes with a nice dinner salad with their homemade Italian dressing. Everything was delicious! The pasta is very filling. Made with ricotta cheese and topped with mozzarella and I added meatballs. My whole experience was just perfect and I never even felt like I was dining alone because the service was so friendly! I will be making this my new Italian spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House salad with their home made Italian dressing
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. mostaccioli al forno with meatballs! Literally delicious. Ricotta and mozzarella with their homemade meatballs.

60caUXy3pqFcHAlIVpSPBw.text: I love this place! Awesome margarita pizza and Caesar salad. Staff is always friendly and helpful. I been coming here for years now and enjoy it every time!

NCaSvCsLXy6oSxjV6H38QQ.text: Okay, there is so much that is good and wonderful about this place! I'm so glad that we found it. Let me tell you first and foremost that the food is oh so very good and the portion sizes are more than generous! Be prepared to be stuffed! Secondly, the service is quite friendly. If you are eating in please know it's a relatively small place so be prepared for a wait if you are coming at a busy time (Saturday at dinner time - watch out)! That's not to say that I'm encouraging you to opt for take out. I'm not. The food is worth the wait and always best enjoyed fresh and hot out of the kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mon-Thurs 9:30-9:00 Fri-Sat 9:30-10:00 Sun 11:00-8:00
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Low key but oh so wonderful!

CbHICA2DdXvS23siPChGtw.text: My hubby met me here for lunch and it was crazy delicious. I've come to this location since 2006 and love everything on the menu. The only reason why I am taking a star away is that it took over 30 minutes just for us to get our lunch. My hubby ordered a calzone and I did the shrimp and marinara appetizer. I felt so bad that he had to quickly rush out the moment his lunch arrived and did not have time to sit down and enjoy it. Aside from the long wait, their food is truly delicious. We will be giving this spot one quick try for lunch again.

XMJewIEoHQnXQGv66sfGmg.text: Great real Italian Deli./Restaurant...everything authentic Italian. Worth the drive for sure.

YVabsQ5sU2tLSV1Wi7ORfg.text: Just had lunch with the guys, food and service were outstanding. Some of the best Italian food in the valley.

RHSG9_TDMiwMpxB7o-ylRg.text: First time here and I will be back soon! The service was fast and friendly. The decor is very unique, and love seeing all the Chicago memorabilia since I'm from the area.    I tried the chicken parmesan sandwich, great flavor and filling! We shared an order of fries, be careful they are SO addicting.   Honestly, best fries I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1ggeBkYBvnvwJXMHk3rbmw.text: I've been eating here for years...actually decades. We used to come here for lunch when I was in high school and it has always remained a family favorite. Service is always nice and fast and they have some of the best sandwiches around. I can't get away from the Howie pastrami and it never disappoints(although messy). I love having this little gem close to home!

U18YZfoUPgO7J0J4i11eog.text: Some amazing ass food is cooked in this place. A coworker recommended this place for lunch and I'm glad he did. Very warm cozy Chicago style eatery. Wait staff were all very pleasant and attentive. I ordered the broasted chicken with coleslaw. Bomb! The chicken was moist and juicy and delish. Coworkers ordered half sandwiches (meatball parm and Italian). Everyone cleared their plates.   We decided to finish with a bang and order a cannoli for desert. It was my first time having one and it was an amazing experience. Definitely will return to try their pasta dishes and sandwiches!

8QNQINeX3tWikdMecf6U8Q.text: I love this place. Great sandwiches and amazing homemade Italian sausage. They also import some goodies from Italy. I used to shop at Guido's growing up in Berkeley Illinois. Great Italian deli. If you've never been give them a try.

DKj1utH5N_RCeOyQ7zb8yA.text: MMM this was wicked and delicious. Such an interesting restaurant, being a restaurant/food shop combo. You can get deli meat, pre-made braciole, cannolis, and so many other items to take home, or you can order off their very long and expansive menu. I got a dish that had broccoli, sausage, chicken, all cooked in olive oil. Can't remember its name, but it was amazing. I had a bite of a friend's broasted chicken, and it was cooked to perfection. Huge portions, just like any good Italian restaurant.

dtaobJt_QwJaCijbxVfTAA.text: I lived in Scottsdale in 2000 and visited here often. They absolutely had the best Cracked Pepper Smoked Turkey sandwich ever. Here it is 2017 and I still rate this deli the best in Scottsdale. Unfortunately they no longer have my most favorite sandwich but you still can't go wrong with any selection.  Great Pastrami sandwich too.  If you like specialty type foods you'll love the  great Italian shopping.    Michael Sealy

6_eolRWosU_43Y8FAVxleg.text: This place is awesome. Authentic, delicious Italian food. Small grocery area with imported items. Deli has everything you could want from meats to olives to desserts. This is a staple and a must when you're in this area craving authentic, comforting, Italian. Delicious!

vXyYt_EbZyePrJleyYQ88g.text: such a fun long time gem, great place to get the decadent gelato  and all your favorite european products, at a great price, and a fantastic italian deli  counter  i am so happy to have remebered this amazing family run place

befBfNlePw6hivyYrxuZmA.text: Ahhhh, sweet, sweet Guido's.   This place rocks. Just met a friend for lunch and had the prosciutto & Provolone and some fries... I know, I know- but they are all worth it. I can't say enough about how great the food is here. I used to go way more often when I lived closer, but I still try to get back whenever I can.   It's a nice little place with indoor and outdoor seating, not enough to be crazy, just enough to fill the place up right. They are quick enough for a business lunch and I promise if you take a client here, they will thank you and want to bring people back.   The owner is ALWAYS there, and is always watching over the place, something I find very admirable and effective. While I was there, I watched him walking through the place straightening out, a big plus for me.   The prices are in line with a sub shop of much lesser quality so for the same money you can get real Italian stuff :) Definitely worth stopping in if you like good food and laid back atmosphere.

NtCSgQ-uj4xaJZmT8ewplQ.text: Amazing food the homemade sausage is so good I want to have more right now. This is a must go back to place to enjoy the rest of the menu items!

IAH4Qj1_yj1sIWAjRuDZvQ.text: Wow. Was looking for a great Italian Beef sandwich and had heard about this place. So had to try. So glad I did. Sandwich was great. Atmosphere was also great. Lots of great Italian food. Service was also superb.

TRkz4_8sc8ZJHC-dezf12Q.text: I love Italian food. I never need a menu because I always order chicken parmigiana. Tonight, I ordered the broasted chicken because my friends from Chicago were raving about it. I'm from New York, we had rotisserie chicken, fried chicken or barbecued chicken, I had never heard of broasted chicken. It was AWESOME. I would definitely recommend it. The bonus was the broasted potatoes. I did not like the cole slaw. I tasted onions which I despise. My husband loved the slaw, he loves onions. The server was very quick to switch out the cole slaw for an onion free house salad. I would recommend this gem.

iucd6bxhXLe3J-RGpw9xLg.text: BTW, later than night, both my 4 year old daughter and I got food poisoning. two days of throwing up. Nice!  Yelp, please stop allowing lies to be perpetuated. Also, have an option for NO stars and put a picture of a person barfing next to it so I could rate this place with that...

ze5OyMCLpeRWJWg-gvzq-A.text: Great place - authentic Italian subs and grocery items.

nQxgF-rJ6vKJ9LyQQth8iQ.text: What a find on the corner of Shea and N. scottsdale Blvd.  Great tasting food, great service, great menu.  The pizza was to die for and did not upset the senior stomach.  The broasted chicken, the best ever, the spaghetti w sausage or meatball fantastic using a home made sauce.  Cannot say anything less about this place with some outside seating.   If your looking for fantastic food in a none formal setting, this is the place.  I will definitely return to this one.

VLlbyv-fB0qY0cm2A8HZWA.text: Stopped into Guido's tonight.  What a great place.  Doing the low carb thing and had meatballs and a salad.  Everything was very tasty.  I brought pasta and garlic bread home for the girls.  They liked it as well.    I've been to Guido's many times.  It is a Chicago style Italian Deli.   I've had the Italian beef and sausage. Tastes great but is a heart  attack waiting to happen.  The Pizza is good too.  I love the grocery/deli decor.  The staff is very friendly and the prices are reasonable.

xq5wi-v-svsFDJrwAc5wzg.text: Had the Italian Sub VERY GOOD! The service was great very friendly and my sandwich came out quickly.  Would vista again!

qT9Vllg1XM0NxEAdTCqXpQ.text: Dig this place. It helps that it is within long-boarding distance of the crib, but even if it wasn't, I'd still make the drive. Granted it is located in a strip-mall, but what isn't down here. Very authentic Chicago-style deli feel to the inside, a handful of booths, tables and a few spots to sit outside on the sidewalk if that's what you prefer. Typically I get the Meatball Parmesan sandwich, the meatballs are fantastic, (that's a good meatball) but I've tried many others including their pizza, all tasty and large portions. They also have the fresh deli counter for meats, cheese, etc as well as many other staples for your home-made Italian dishes, check it out, glad I did.

DQJwdu60BG3nZOndMoOWmA.text: even if you aren't going to get a full meal, you NEED to get a cannoli.. or maybe 5. best I have ever had in my life. every time I get something to go I wish I would have ordered one more.

hK7k3ADr6K5JNpnwb3_GQQ.text: Poor service mediocre food. NY NJ native we appreciate Chicago food, this was very poor imitation of Italian food.

ihsY3hw_dzikF1SoETrfRg.text: Awesome deli! Salami is awesome and pizza pasta is top notch! Worth the drive from Tempe.

brE9oVEqT82U4S-2t42wrg.text: I was very excited about visiting Guido's. Been looking for a good Italian sub shop that cranks out a nice chicken parm sub. I went to Guido's with my wife and four year old daughter. The atmosphere was what I expected for an Italian market. The selection of items for sale was also interesting. As you wait for your food you can peruse the market area to kill time. The service was very attentive and the waitress was sweet. My wife ordered the fried calamari and she said it was delicious. So good even my four year old ate some. My daughter had a bowl of pasta with butter and cheese. Not rocket science at all. I ordered my longtime craved chicken parm sub. I was somewhat satisfied but the sauce was a little generic and the two pieces of chicken were so small they did not even fill the bread up. I would say overall my dish was okay. I would give them a try again as the menu is varied and I would give another dish a shot. The prices seemed very fair to me. I wish I could give them four stars but just not good enough the first time around. I will keep an open mind for next time and maybe find another star. Good appetite to you all!

uDkQNmPMTHJCFrTo0Wjx1A.text: I had the italian combo sandwich and it was delicious. Also the French fries were made from fresh potatoes and were great. As for the gentleman who stated they needed more salt, that's what a salt shaker is for. Personally I thought they were perfect. The only negative I can say was the slice of pizza we had was real doughy and not very good. Overall food and atmosphere was very good.

jtVKUVHQprwVsVgFxRoGdA.text: Guido's has to be the best kept secret. The food is phenominal and very reasonably priced! The deli and grocery section carry all the Italian specialty items you could ever want. And to top it all off, they sometimes serve the most delicious tamales ever. As if that is not enough, Joe Guido, the owner, always makes you  feel at home.

Idd1MHn4zToephllvaQlxA.text: So.... having lived in Scottsdale for several years (back then), when I came back five  + years later, Guido's was on my list of places to visit while here....  The food is exactly as I remember!  My favorite is the Chicago Style Combo, which is absolutely phenomenal!

DqdeTI0C4zIint4bvbovdA.text: This place made me sangry (sad + angry). I really wanted to like it as an Italian who works right around the corner.   Went here with my work team for lunch on a Friday and the service was so slow I missed my regular after-lunch meeting with my boss. Not cool! Not only did the food take forever to come out, paying the bill felt like it took just as long as eating. As we were wrapping up, I let the waitress know we were in a hurry, but it was at least 10 minutes until we got our check. I walked up to the counter area to ask her about it, and it was clear there was some confusion about our bill and what we ordered. Probably because one in our party was served well before everyone else (probably someone else's pasta), one who ordered chicken for her pasta never got it, and other general poor service related issues. She asked me to sit back down and said she'd bring it out to us, so I sat for countless minutes more until I eventually went up to her again only to have her tell me she thought she'd dropped it off already and had it in her apron pocket. OMG was I seeing red by that time.   If the food had at least been good, I might have been in a better mood,... but out of the six of us not ONE of us enjoyed the meal. The food was mediocre - like my reheated manicotti that seemed like a frozen Marie Callender's someone heated in the microwave. The garlic bread was rock hard and only edible after soaking it in red sauce for a few minutes to soften it out of desperation because the rest of our food was terrible.  Looking back at the reviews, perhaps sandwiches to-go might be alright, but I would never repeat our pasta eat-in experience ever again.

yb9htvoEZPEWfNNNWEi-Xw.text: I love this place! It is an really cool old school Italian deli with the kinds of things my grandparents would have just loved- lots of imported groceries, gardineria, sweets and deli meats.   My absolute favorites are the Italian roast beef (great sub rolls!) and you must get the fresh mozzarella appetizer- half moons of crispy fried mozzarella served with marinara.

rDYPJs2InqznTf7mQJ4EoQ.text: Went there tonight for dinner and will NEVER  go back! The owner is rude. His computer system was down tonight and made this everyones problem but his own. He told his customers to go to a bank/atm and then come back and pay their bill. I don't have an atm card, so now what??  He was loud and overbearing to customers. His loss, will not return..

G9hnPcF3TU48k9lDUfANnA.text: I was wandering around the shopping center at Shea and Scottsdale Road at lunch trying to decide what to eat.  I noticed a little Italian Deli, and was amazed  - it was before noon and the placed was packed.  I went in and before I looked at the menu, I wandered around looking at the diners and their plates.  The diners were very mixed - professionals,  construction workers, couples, singles, and groups. They all seemed to have something different, and they all seemed to be enjoying what they were eating.    So I decided to give it a try.  The person who took my order spoke heavily accented Italian, but I managed to convey what I wanted, which was really simple - an Italian Sub with salami, Mortadella, Pepperoni & Provolone.  It was packed with onions, tomatoes, and lettuce, and drenched in sub oil.  It was great, delicious - made me aware of what I had been missing all my life - and more than filled me up.  My only disappointment was that I was full - I wanted to try everything on their menu, because everything looked so tempting.  But they are close to my home, so I'm sure it will become my lunchtime favorite.  I only gave them 4 stars, since I only had the sandwich.  But I will update as I visit them again and try their complete menu, which also includes salads, pasta, pizza, and different kinds of subs.

oni4eKmsZNgk3mG5C_aPJw.text: Everything is amazing!  Guido makes the world's best sandwich. They are all great but ask for a lemon pepper chicken with hot peppers.

g_LppivXaBgIPlQXlxAdYA.text: Lov this place.  Italian subs, specialty italian foods, homemade salsicc!  Table service and pizza.  When u want to hear some south side and have great food, go here.

RTmL-ytqakM7ijkkftohZQ.text: Most people probably come to Guidos for sandwiches, pasta and great meats but I've found their Seafood salad. It is really chock full of shrimp, mussels, squid , crab and crisp lettuce etc. the dressing is great Italian oil n vinegar . This is my choice for a wonderful lunch! It comes with hot seasoned bread too.

A0fZD0o3aZf643N4n-UnVQ.text: Five solid stars for the best meatballs I can remember eating in a LONG time!!!  YUM!  It also didn't hurt that my Husband and I were able to enjoy a couple of beers in frosty mugs (frosty mugs alone = 5 stars) out on the patio while Freddy whipped up a couple of fresh slices of pizza for us.  Fabulous meatballs, frosty mugs and fresh slices of pizza = 5 Stars in my book!

TtWXKwE4zo28COe6CLZ0mw.text: Been back a few times since my first review. The food is still amazing. I have been getting there early, guessing before all of the staff arrives, but after they are open. The morning staff, especially the guy usually on the grill, just lack the friendly service I get when I go later in the day and get to deal with a waitress or the owner. I will keep going but hoping they read this about the 'morning experience'.

uPCa4hs3fI57FKmMVWV_hw.text: Delicious food.  Breasted chicken....fried shrimp.....cole slaw....lasagne. And they deliver!!!!!

SeuSpeTQAyULGARMD1E6yQ.text: They have my favorite Chicken Parm sandwich AND the best French fries in town.     The fries are thicker than most but smaller than a steak-cut and they practically melt in your mouth.  I had never had fries like these...they are incredible.  They finish the sandwich off in the oven so the bread is lightly crunchy when it comes out.  I did get a sandwich that was a little overdone for my taste once, and didn't notice it until after I had left with my to go order so keep an eye on that.  I think the food quality may suffer a bit when the owner isn't working.   The Calzones are huge and taste pretty good.   The Cannoli from their deli are a favorite in our office.

50FDz8tT5BOla9NKhIS77Q.text: Great lunch spot hidden in a strip mall.  Everything I've eaten on the menu is great.  The owner is very personable and add to the authentic feel of this grocery store/ deli.

ckGMAreb5nWVqHSMSVUq1w.text: I told my mom to take me to somewhere good we could sit down and have an actual meal. She chose this, she has some obsession with deli's of late. I had the eggplant entree with spaghetti and garlic bread. The eggplant had a not so fresh color and it was a bit too salty for my taste. The spaghetti was great the sauce was sweet and fresh unlike the eggplant. This was lunch time mind you maybe no one orders eggplant parm so much. The garlic bread was delicous and next time I will just try a sandwich or pizza. The service was excellent the place was nice it wasn't busy. They had framed write ups in the paper posted. I'd give it another go.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg plant parm entree w spaghetti

9LF8iF6v2WuVPDihfMVneg.text: One of the best meals I've had in a long time with great prices!  I had the calamari and Howie's Pastrami Sandwich.  Both were incredible! I highly recommend it.

IxUlq2kCG8VDUyzHQR-QKw.text: Haven't been in for years but the home made sausages were killer!

yMfVglzuOJN64gaxX37JCQ.text: I love this place!  Their bread is sooooo good, which in turn means their sandwiches are amazing!  All of the sandwiches I've tried are good but, I usually get a half a turkey sub with a side of hot peppers and coleslaw.  I could literally eat tubs of their slaw.  It's the best slaw I've ever had in my life!  The broasted chicken is also delicious.  It was juicy, full of flavor, and not greasy.  The fries were amazing as well.  Their salads are delicious too.  They're full of meat cheese and veggies and their dressing is delicious.  Their desserts are also very good.  I've tried the cannoli and cheesecake, both were delicious!

S2zuLIyaJ-_YMnTiZgDC2w.text: This place is amazing..!! From the atmoshere to the customer service and the food speaks for itself.  I have visited twice now, in the same week, both experiences were eough for me to write this "my first writen review, ever".  I was simply taken by the entire experience, I recommend making Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli a must on everyone's to do list.  My first visit I enjoyed their signature sausage sub, best hot sandwhich I ever had.  My next visit, I ate the Pork Loin sandwhich (ask for it-not on menu) Just in case you're wondering, I am not related in any way to the owner or his employees.  I was working in the area last week and solicited the place.  Had to go back three times in order to get a minute of the owners undivided attention. (Keep in mind, most people see me and run in the other direction)

-zodz6ePhPMpV5Lg-qBy5g.text: I'm all over this place. The Hot Chicago Roast Beef sandwich is the best in Scottsdale. Pizza is superb, Guido hails directly from the "Windy City". Still qualifies as "reasonably priced", even during our economic slow down.

RmnnHJQAH_Or-TLxnPdsQg.text: Guido's looks like a classic italian deli to me, and a good one.  Disclaimer:  I am no expert, not being italian or ever frequented an italian neighborhood.  That being said, I sure would like to.    Meatballz was closed again and we all needed our fix.  Guido's hit the spot with their italian beef sandwich that was cheesey, juicy and on some of the best crusty roll I've had in a while.  On the downside, the beef was pretty tough, so I'll probably have to go back to test it out again.  Spaghetti and meatballs had a well made gravy and meatballs that looked pretty good, and my son said were good, but he wouldn't even let me have a tiny taste.  Never seen him mop up sauce with garlic bread before, but he took it up like a pro.  They sell fresh pasta, pre-made entrees and salads, meats, italian ice and spumoni and the sought out San Marzano tomatoes.  The inventory is presented really well - not a speck of dust to be found on any can or shelf, fresh looking, well stocked and orderly.  Guido's has the potential for five stars if everything tastes as good as it looks.  Looks like a few more visits are in order.

wYEY4pgCXThbP10hzT_FGA.text: Great chicken parm, incredible prosciutto caprese sandwich!

GFF0sbFNbcucum4PAAwUcg.text: We ALWAYS drive from Chandler to go to Guidos. We LOVE the place. The food is consistently off the charts. Folks...this is not fast food. This is good food done fast. There is depth of flavor, quality of ingredients & passion for service. Guido's broasted chicken is amazing & my wife's meatball sandwich has everything you could want in a quality sandwich. Then, Guido brought out two pieces of broasted fish. It blew me away. It was like a battered fish steak. Go...sample everything. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Guido is the best at what he does. Go see my dude Guido!

eNFA0xhQP4LkW224QMX5Kw.text: Woohoo! As good as Italian gets in Arizona! Do you yearn for a REAL veal parm sandwich you can sink your teeth into...the crusty bread, the thick soft tasty lean veal, the tangy sauce, the melting cheese. It's SOOOOOO good it makes me crazy!! Outstanding Italian sausage and peppers, too. Not cheap, but excellent value and quantity for the money.

Qd6dgB2nZVNy3IjLsUJ4Lw.text: FOOD POISONING! My wife and I are both horribly sick after eating a sausage and peppers sandwich Guido's sold at the Italian festival in Scottsdale. We will NEVER eat anything from this place again.

90tpUH0a1uBQdw2-DYGGWQ.text: If it were not for yelp I would never have found this place. Tucked away in the back corner of a massive commercial complex its easy to miss; I actually had a hard time locating it. As I approached the front door I was greeted with a hand written note indicating the card machine was down and they were only accepting cash - but that didn't deter me. Came with two buddies and we decided to get a table close to the deli case which allowed for some good people watching and really helped to soak in the ambiance. It has the Italian deli feel to it; you know...the one with friendly people, all kinds of products you can't get at the grocery store, the finest quality cold cuts and cheese, homemade bread, and freezers packed with ice cream and pastas. We all opted for sandwiches; and the full size. Holy smokes were they massive and to be honest us full grown men could have gotten by on half a sandwich each. I chose the meatball marinara as I think it's a good way to judge a place - you get a feel for their sauce and the meat they use. The sauce was just a tiny bit on the sweet side for me but I have to say it's one of the best I have ever had. Meatballs were juicy and of quality ingredients. Both the sauce and meatballs were simply yet super complex in terms of taste. The bread was soft and light on the inside but crispy on the outside - truly a work of art. Topped off with some provolone cheese and a side of sauce for dipping was the finishing touches of a masterpiece. Great people, even better food...what else could you ask for. I will be back.

EtFpW9oSGaBhBdjseb9BFw.text: Did some take out meals for dinner and the food is terrific! The pesto ravioli is terrific and the eggplant parm is even better. We also ordered pasta primavera with marinara sauce and it was excellent as well. Meals. Amen with nice fresh salads and garlic bread. All terrific! We got a few Italian pastries for dessert- YUM!! Great place that I always visit when I visit Scottsdale. If you haven't been here, you need to get here!

1BMF_l_bHNJUxudB_FjFzw.text: Guido's has recently become my go-to for fresh cookies, biscotti, and other treats, but I finally decided to sit down and take part in their restaurant experience.   It's really a cute little diner, and other than being a restaurant, it also is an entire Italian grocery store. They have all the Italian cooking ingredients you would need along with the cookies, gelato, and even clothing that you can buy. Plus, the place is all one room, so you can see the chefs cooking right in front of you. It all really adds to the ambiance as if it was something you would see on Diners, Drive-in's, and Dives.   When we walked in, we were immediately seated, even though the restaurant was quite busy. The service was friendly and attentive, too. We started off ordering the calamari appetizer that was delicious. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the calamari was not tough at all, which can be a problem for Arizona restaurants. We received the calamari first, but it was a little slow getting out the rest of the orders (I don't really blame them, though, since it was quite busy with customers and take-out orders). I ordered the pesto ravioli while my friends ordered chicken piccata and soup. It was all good, home style food, but too heavy for my taste. The best thing we tried was their red sauce spaghetti that comes with the chicken, but I was underwhelmed by my dish. It was not only very heavy, but was a "one-note" kind of dish.   Overall, they have a good range of Italian food that would be great for a night out, but nothing that would make me want to sit down in their restaurant again soon. For now I'll just have to stick with their yummy treats.

pJ7mz23YdvU6j_3IaBpeNg.text: Even though I am from Pittsburgh I love this neighborhood CHICAGO Italian Delli. In 30 Years I've only had great food here. When in Scottsdsle this should be a must-go destination.

GS_FGxYsc7bXcN-3FEAsjQ.text: We came back to Guidos as it has been a couple of years.  Guido's needs an establishment in So. Cal.  It would do terrific business!!  A great deli that serves meals on the other side of the house.  They also have a small but great selection of condiments for cooking and other items to make a great dinner at home as well.  We had the Pastrami sandwich and of course the broasted chicken.  First off, the service was terrific.  Our server was great.  He was friendly, knowledgeable and on top of everything!!  The bang for the buck is pretty good here.  The Broasted Chicken platter which is 4 pieces of awesome broasted chicken, salad, great toasted garlic bread and three large pieces of broasted potatoes.    The flavor on all the items was on point and it was great to see the QA is still in tact and the food was just terrific.  All that food for just $14.    The Pastrami Sandwich was also very good and tasty and served on a nicely toasted roll.  I could not find one thing wrong with our visit.  The food was superb, the service was awesome and the bang for the buck was perfect.  We finished off our dinner with their chocolate cake and three servings of their Gelato.  White Chocolate, Rasberry (WOW!!!!) and Pistachio.  I thought the serving was going to be normal but each serving was the size of a baseball.  LOL!!!!  It was funny as I could not eat all of this and had much to share with everyone.  It is absolutely worth trying.  The cake was light and not dense with good consistency and flavor and the Gelato was just terrific.    Once again, I highly recommend going to Guido's!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oh my, what a dessert!!!

sjQFmet7tC2_qgMZTyAY0w.text: Well we were in the area and stopped in for lunch. It's a small, deli type of place, a few tables, restroom was clean well stocked. Staff was nice, it wasn't slammed busy but there were several customers and we didn't have any issues with service as I have read on some of the reviews.  I feel kinda bad basing my review on a sandwich, but it's what I ordered. I ordered a hot pastrami sandwich a half, the bread was crispy, fresh and soft inside. It was topped with lettuce, two slices of tomato and onions with italian dressing mayo and mustard. It's enough to get full of off, does it scream something special... Not in my opinion.  My husband ordered the Italian sausage it was an encased sausage topped with marinara sauce and cheese, onions and green peppers, he ordered a whole and he just said it was ok, at 12 bucks he said he coulda ordered something better. We also so ordered a side of fries, nothing special there either.  I wouldn't say it's a terrible place, I'd say a little pricey, for just ok food. It's not something I'd crave or run to, don't even think we would go back.

8xtx-l8xmz5Z6Vz-NfEGSg.text: This place has everything you could hope for!  Their food is delicious.  I recommend the lasagna and Italian beef.  The atmosphere is great, it's a little family owned shop with great Chicago decor and Italian deli items for purchase.  The service is wonderful, and the owner/manager truly cares that you have a perfect experience.

ezkkMcLVbjVNlL5pk__v1A.text: My husband and I had lunch here yesterday. We sat outside. Our server (she's the hostess too) was fast moving, attentive and very friendly. The food was outstanding and the restaurant is stock full of EVERYTHING Italian!!! We're from Chicago and I'm Italian. Guido's ROCKS!!! We'll be back!

t2SoEGArA5BTY-mVY6chKQ.text: Authentic food. Great 'hole in the wall 'place! Great spot to go on s date or just grab and go

W_sICcOuSCcz_y3QKdLisQ.text: So good it leaves me sick with longing............................ Back again. Holy moly donut shop. Tried the meatball sub & chicken parmesan sub. So good I could slap myself. Amen and amen.

pRblEsOJZ6IFrk7vvbGfgw.text: Love, Love the Italian Combo Sandwich, some of the staff need an attitude adjustment Please...be nice that's all I'm asking.

DVJUt-8ayYg7JghnWRYb5g.text: I have been going to Joe's restaurant for 20 years now....love it and him!! Wonderful man that puts his Heart in his food.. And a major kudos to his beautiful wife Ada. Whom is just as devoted

Gmabs1WcZI2QO9yiKuCFIg.text: Another little  gem tucked in on the northeast corner of Scottsdale  And Shea been coming here for  25 years absolutely love it The very nice surprise is how good the tuna fish sandwich is for something different

AK3lZjNGjqc5ve9JfEiDYA.text: Some of the best Italian food around....been in business like 35 years!!!  3 of us stopped for late lunch- linguini with clams, lasagne and a huge Italian beef and sausage sandwich.....all were excellent.

jv1PYgjDMU0InS6lyShAUg.text: Not a phrase I use often, but this place is a gem. It really does feel like a little piece of Chicago. Classic Italian comfort food, clean, and cozy. It's one of the more unique dining experiences you'll find in Scottsdale.

ENr1OWJmwcZzYI-OCs1kGg.text: Delizioso...my sister & I spit the meatball sandwich & the roast beef / sausage Chicago sandwich. Very good!!! Love the marinara sauce, love the food...wow. Nice to see an Italian deli close to home. I'll be back.

YJMwWoI0gwISoKPXI6ireA.text: PLEASE READ AND SEE PHOTOS OF PAST REVIEWS  AS TO SAVE YOU FROM BEING SCAMED CHICAGO STYLE. Three of us went to Guido's and ordered three dishes one of the dishes was a prosciutto sandwich . The prosciutto  had a taste of a refrigerator  I can't really explain it but it wasn't good. We asked the server to take it back . Just a moment later short  a Hispanic woman showed up with a slab of prosciutto and  proceeded to tell us that she just opened the slab and she was sorry but she would have to charge us for the sandwich in  a very nasty and aggressive way.  We told her that it had a weird taste and we would be happy to pay for the rest of the meal but not for that sandwich. The lady said that if we don't pay for the sandwich also she would call the police we agreed and asked her to call the police. The police showed up and explain to us that the lady was ready to file charges for theft of services and that they could do nothing if we wouldn't pay for the sandwich we would be arrested. We told the police that we did not eat the sandwich we took one bite and it was bad and returned it . We had no choice and we paid by credit card and wrote on the receipt that we intended to dispute the charge for that bad tasting prosciutto sandwich. The idea that a business would act in such a manner to regular customers that are only guilty of returning a sandwich that tasted bad And were forced to pay for  it Under the threat of being arrested is literally The meaning of insanity. If you plan to visit Guido's I strongly suggest you not return any dish even if it's spoiled or bad or you're going to face the possibility of being arrested if you refuse to pay for the bad smelling prosciutto sandwich.
