j2uXsHnWAfg_whuqUAVNcw.text: The kids really enjoyed soup and sandwich and the waitress was kind enough to split a single order between the two of them, to make it kid size. My husband really enjoyed the pastrami sandwich and my stuffed shells were good, but the french fries were awesome!

I7jiLwHWOcPC-DKkG9XFgw.text: One of the best authentic Italian food places in the area that I have found!  Everything is fresh and made from scratch.  It's hidden in the corner of a Safeway shopping center I would never think to go in for Italian food but now I'm just mad I have lived in the area for 10 years and just found this place about a year ago.

cevd-FGu_DIYxS0XyjEFfA.text: The Italian Beef sandwich is crazy good here. I forget the name of my waitress, but she was amazing. "Above and beyond." We were first timers and the food and service made such a good impression on me.. Will be back next time I'm craving one of those Italian beefs.

PWoGuPbmBNq_t-C_EBCrEw.text: One of the more amazing finds thanks to Yelp.   I would not have found this place just passing by on the street.  It's a bit out of the way in the Safeway shopping center.  Everytime I've gone, everything was really fresh and flavorful.  I especially like the Italian sub.  Probably the best sandwich I've ever had.  I wish there was a place like this near where I live, I'd go there at least once a week.

4gs2DnkZZIgLAl7oiwwNGg.text: Food was good, not great. You want an Italian grocer/restaurant just like this but much better......you head to andreoli Italian grocer also in north Scottsdale.

kZOzDLvvWP8dZzu-iG0qFw.text: Been coming into Guido's since the late 80's. This ain't Chi-town or NY or Philly, so get over it. It's Scottsdale and its the best Chicago/Italian deli this side of the Illinois river. I haven't found another deli this side of town that is better.  Food is great. I've eaten everything on the menu. All fresh. Some things they make the night before but I can tell you for a fact that food does not hang around here for more than 24 hours.   I actually like the tuna sub. Of course, the bread makes the sammy. I always buy a loaf and some meatballs from the deli to make a pasta dinner for the family.  I'm not going to be pretentious and make recommendations. Go for yourself and see.  Oh, and the owner always says goodbye to me when I get up and leave.  Yea, that's a 5 STAR act in my book.  BADDABING!

Svl5VCAZPVqpxz_PPOjDYg.text: Best Italian sausage and roast beef in the valley hands down! The have a huge selection of Italian groceries too. Also the homemade cannolis are delicious!

vIClE1KfHSxNjcT16JwDDg.text: Enjoyable little place. Great sandwiches, salads, and good selection of Italian groceries.

Hu1IR_jfbTIgbUCsXIImvw.text: Legit meatball sandwhich.  Broasted Chicken moist juicy hot, just they way I like it.

Ao89PnaRL2jTQQeiTHPxcw.text: Clean, neat, friendly and GOOD. Definitely a bias toward Chicago style sandwiches, pizza and Italian dishes. Had the Chicago roast beef sandwich with sausage and peppers, and au jus. Au hell - tasty! Will be back.

EzecgGMw7URphgf9UpJhbw.text: Grand children sporting events in the area took me there twice this week. Sandwiches both times were outstanding! Bread was fresh and they give you a very generous serving of meat. It has a large deli meat selection. Lots of "regulars " in the place of lunch.

DX2mHK9PBmPWsj2nXHSM-w.text: Fantastic! Awesome atmosphere and food is top notch! It was worth the 30 mile drive for me!

fgsrSpnLFf1Izz5RKNI6YA.text: We have had really good luck here....Scottsdale is awash with this sort of fare, mostly boring, but this one works..... not really cheap but we feel the food is well worth it.  the owner is   very experienced and has a really super crew in the kitchen.....I don't think your going to do any better around here or for that matter pretty much anywhere else....He really watches the quality....give it a shot!!!!!!!!!!!!

NaukkH3uMIdqGtYkV0nY_w.text: Not real sure what all the fuss is about their Broasted chicken which is actually fried chicken plus something else,  We got the 4 piece meal to go.  The broasted potatoes were boring fried potatoes.  The cole slaw has garlic it in and actually made me throw up which of course is not a good sign.  The chicken I expected juicy mouth watering juicy, which I did not get. it was dry, dry dry. The chicken is better at Costco and way less expensive.  I had to put apple sauce on my chicken to make it moist.  I would tell Guido to stick to one thing which you do good and avoid all the rest as they also sell very high priced pasta dishes, which I have not tried as they are very high priced even for Scottsdale.  The chicken dinner was also suppose to come with bread and butter and it did not it came with very dried out garlic bread.  If they had been honest and said it comes with garlic bread I would have asked for just bread and butter as I do not like garlic bread.

HbRGVuglIz04ZlwR8txzEA.text: Stopped in today while waiting for a haircut next door, WOW!   I had noticed this place a few times before, but was never hungry or didn't have to wait for the haircut.   This place is awesome! Reminds me of the Italian deli around the corner from my grandparents house in Pittsburgh. Fresh, Fresh, Fresh!   Had the capicola and hard salami with provolone, sub. Bread had obviously been baked that day, and the meat/cheese was so fresh you would have thought the cows and pigs were out back!   I will continue to get a mediocre haircut over here just to have an excuse to drive out of my way for this food!

PPWY0T-DPY5x3iKAAco43w.text: Worst experience! We have been to this restaurant a few times and while we love the food and atmosphere, the lack of customer service and class that the owner/manager showed to us tonight was absolutely inexcusable. After we ordered our food, the waitress told us that their credit card machine was down but that it should be fixed soon. After we ate our meal, we were presented with the check without a word about the machine. We figured it got fixed. When the waitress brought our credit card back to our table she said that the machine was still down. She told us we had to leave the restaurant and find an ATM that we could use, then come back to pay cash. I told her that I really didn't want to have to do that, considering we had a small child with us. I offered to pay by check. She checked with the owner/manager and he said no. She apologized to us and said that she would have taken the check if it were up to her. All of a sudden the owner/manager comes to our table and starts yelling about the situation. He said that he was "stuck" and that there was nothing he could do about it. I offered again to pay by check but he told me that there was "no way" he could take that. I said "so you will run the risk of all these people leaving to go get money instead of offering an alternative way to pay, such as a check?" Then he started blabbering about God or something like that. I also told him that we will get charged a fee to pull out of the nearest ATM, then he said "well how much can that fee be? Here take a couple bucks off the bill" I said "forget it, don't bother" He was throwing his arms up in the air and he was very loud, which was completely embarrassing to us. This was a Saturday night around 7pm, and it was very crowded. My small child saw that the man was yelling at me so she started crying, saying "mommy!" We could have made an even bigger scene since we did nothing wrong and were being treated so poorly, but we chose the high road. Needless to say, we left to find cash and brought it back. We will never return there again and I will be sharing this experience with our friends and family. So disappointing.

hHJ5rh_6Zh6YwwMFsCsVEA.text: Been coming to Guido's since we moved to Scottsdale in 1997.  Back then there was much more family running the place.  The only 2 people I recognize now are the cook (always the same dude) and Guido.  Of all the reviews I read on Guido's (I didn't read them all, admittedly), I'm shocked more people didn't try the Broasted Chicken.  Not "fried" chicken, but a close cousin and absolutely terrific.  Juicy, crispy and darn good.  Comes with 3 huge Broasted potato wedges and cold slaw.  Let's talk about the cold slaw:  BEST in the state.  Has some kind of oniony taste that just knocks it out of the park.  Sounds strange, but sometimes I crave the cold slaw more than the chicken!   Wings are solid.  Pizza's OK (I'm from Brooklyn and a huge pizza snob, so nothing in AZ is going to work for me).  Hot Sandwiches are great.  Chicken Parm and Meatball sub are favorites of my teenage sons.  Great selection of beverages.  Interesting beer choices from the help-yourself-refridgerator in the front.  Prices are decent.  Service is spotty, but the kitchen is right in front of you and very open so if things aren't going well, you can walk right up to the cook and tell him.  Also, Guido is always there, so...  Only real disappointment are the frozen "Italian Ices" that sit in a freezer near the front of the place.  They are pre-packaged and frozen.  Tempting to look at, but a poor immitation of the real thing.   If you're headed to the Harkins Shea 14 movie heater or the Big League Dugout for your baseball gear stop in.  With the lack of good Italian places in AZ, this one's worth checking out.

ag9GElOFh2zsoHMZibLUuQ.text: Best Italian Deli in Scottsdale! Such a great place. Good Italian Groceries and even better made to order food. Italian Sandwiches are great!! So fresh!

ycaF8WZ0TX59HBThyMbZxQ.text: Sandwiches are great.  Order at the counter, fast and excellent sandwiches.  Love the Sandwiches, Salami, Caprese and Meatball.  Favorite place to go after golfing on this side of town.

ErTIIecafcJ_uQbvSS4fKw.text: Fantastic place. I ate waaay too much, which is an instant five star. We tried a few things, and I determined this to be the best Italian food I've had so far.  Service was great too. Menu is fairly large, so there is still a lot more left to explore.  Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp Linguine
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mozzarella Sticks
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meat Lasagna

XXc9mcwmek8RZdSLvJk0Ow.text: We've heard about this place for a long time. When we arrived, the place was packed but there were still a few tables available. My wife ordered the Minestrone Soup which was quite different than we are used to. It had a lot of Anelli style pasta with a clear broth. Good but different. The Broasted Chicken my wife had was the BEST she has had in AZ. Not greasy but nice and tender. My Linguini with White Clam Sauce was nice and hot. Not too cheesy and filling. Our server was nice but seemed a bit anxious. I guess because there was only two servers for the entire restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Broasted Chicken with Fries and Cole Slaw
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Side salad
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Linguini and white Clam Sauce

5Y1-1esK_obg-_YsMXzLtw.text: I have always loved this place, but today was awful. I looked at their online menu and placed a phone order for the prosciutto and mozzarella caprese sub. Online it says a whole is 12.99, when I get there to pick it up the man at the counter says it's over $18!!!!! When I ask why, he says the sub is 16.99 before tax! I explained to him that's not what it says on the internet and I even show him the price listed on the internet. He says well that's not right and says I have to pay for their mistake of them not listing the right price on their menu! And then he hands me a paper menu and says see it says on here! Most people use technology and the internet today! Regardless of the error, a $4 dollar increase is not worth their sandwiches. So unfortunately I will not be returning and neither will many of my coworkers.

dmqy7AW79hZEqxRB9vUG_Q.text: Stopped by for late lunch / early dinner.  Had a great meal and always enjoy Italian markets and home made food.  Good service and we did some shopping after eating for some fresh mozzarella, sauce and bread.

Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicago special sun with roast beef and home made sausage

h2p_7AUPOxllyjo_N4p1hw.text: One Saturday, we were looking for Panettone to give as a gift to one of our Italian friends. Panettone is an Italian Sweet Bread Loaf that seems to disappear in your hands after you take the first bite. At least, that's how it is for me.  I was informed that they stocked this particular bread here by the dozens, which meant that we didn't have to keep driving around town looking for it.  However, since I was here around lunch time, we decided to dine here. It is a Deli after all. One of this particular Deli's signature dishes is their Broasted Chicken. It's not an Italian dish, but it's made by Italians from Chicago.   The moment you walk in this place, you will notice just how well maintained and clean this place is. One of the ladies that worked there kept making sure that the place was swept and mopped continually. I wish our tile floors were as gleaming as these on a continual basis.  We sat down in one of the booths, and not only did she do the cleaning. She also was our server! Imagine that!  I ordered the Broasted Chicken, and my wife ordered the Spaghetti Carbonara with a side of meatball. For appetizers, we ordered side salad, and some garlic bread.  The salad as okay, and so was the garlic bread. There was nothing special there.  However, the Broasted Chicken was stupendous. The skin was very crispy, but it was neither overdone nor overly saturated with flour. The meat inside was very tender and juicy. The combination of both was heaven.  I regretted having ordered the smaller portion.   My wife's spaghetti had such a wonderful sauce. And the meatball was huge and absolutely magnificent.  After we were thoroughly satisfied with our meals, we went to pay. As we were leaving, we kept wondering if we were forgetting something. After hopping on the 101 Southbound, we soon realized what we had forgotten - the Panettone!

dqKm32MJquEJW3XEUnqzUw.text: What can I ay ? Broastrd chicken!!! Pizza!!!  Potatoes.  All the good stuff prepared great.  Comfortable fun and good staff.   Highly recommend!

GCSeprjjZ-lQPd59Lm3DQA.text: This is the BEST place to go eat hands. down. The food is affordable and delicious and i can guarantee is better than everythig else in the area. The servers are always welcoming and nice and get to know you. Everything from the mozzarella sticks to the pastas to the sandwiches is always incredibly delicious. They always have the best desserts, i HIGHLY recommend the cheesecake as it's the best i have ever had in my life. Hands down 100/100 stars you need to go here.

vliNfge5NfX7-NJ2Ix_TvA.text: I've had Guido's bookmarked forever. It just so happened that I was talking with a friend of mine and Guido's came up. So what do I do, go home get my wife and we're off to Guido's.   It's an unassuming Italian deli and restaurant. We walk in and not sure what to do cause there's no hostess but one of the servers just tell us to find a table. Cool. They basically have two server handling all the tables inside and outside.   Took a little while but our server came and brought us our drinks. I ordered the Italian combo which is Italian Beef with homemade sausage and grilled onions and peppers with melted mozzarella. This was really good. They give you a cup of sauce to make it even more moist. The bread is fresh too. So good. The more sauce I put on the more I loved it. So good. My wife want to try my sandwich and she couldn't put it down. She loved it too.   My wife ordered her usual the meatball sandwich which happens to be one of my favorites too. Huge meatballs with Marinera sauce with melted mozzarella. I knew I could share with her and boy was it good. Meatballs were really good and loved the sauce. My wife was raving about the bun. So fresh and soft. We both really liked it a lot.   I decided to get a half an order of boasted fries. These were fresh and really good. I know I'm not supposed to eat a lot but so dang good. Not crispy but just right. No complaints here  So this place has an Italian deli with Italian dessert in the freezer too plus a restaurant. Very busy. Very open and reminds me a lot of DeFalco's but less cramped. Very relaxed atmosphere were you can enjoy your Italian meal. The food is spot on. Excellent. The service is pretty good. It's just not one of those place you want to rush to get in and out in a hurry. Enjoy the food. Enjoy the atmosphere. It's really good.   The question is will I be back. Of course I will. My wife even asked me what days they are open and I know she loves it too. Can't wait to try more. I just love Italian food

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicago Italian Combo Sub
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Broasted Fries

Cf-mMAOVmYSiWI00sYn7VQ.text: Holy Mozzarella this place is delicious!! A little touch of Chicago in my own back yard. How I miss Chi-Town and this is the essence of the north shore that I needed.   We had the salami caprese sandwich and the Italian sub. The bread is that perfect mix of crusty and chewy that you are looking for and the fillings are on point.   They were also incredibly kind to my 1 year old daughter. We ordered her a meatball and they offered to bring it out first without us even having to prompt them. Our waiter let us know how long things would take so we made sure to order things that came out quickly. Perfect situation for parents of a toddler!!  Overall I say get yourself over here before Triple D shows up and this place gets swamped!

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Want everything from the deli case!

PnT-SlJUoJx4H3qkvxYrjg.text: Came here for broasted chicken and a eggplant sub. Yummy is all I can say. Good service and they have a deli and little market in here for treats and Italian grocery items.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waiting for our yummy food

WUIyer7Gpo0Wyj7svb6cGg.text: I haven't been to Guido's in a long time and I am sorry I have missed such great food.  My son and daughter-in-law took me there yesterday for my birthday.  I had a taste for fried chicken and they said the broasted chicken at Guido's is one of the best.  They were right.  It was sooooo good.  Perfectly cooked and juicy.  My daughter-in-law and I shared the large broasted chicken dinner.  It is served with a broasted potato which was perfect and cole slaw or a salad.  The cole slaw was just to my taste.  My son had the eggplant parmesan sandwich.  It was gigantic and he said their parm is the best he has tasted.  We also had calamari for an appetizer.  The calamari is always great and the marinara is the best.  The restaurant gave us a pistachio cannoli for my birthday and that was wonderful.  So delicious.  If you haven't tried Guido's go there.

EIuiW7azfGiSl4ou0-PfJg.text: Moved to Phoenix from Chicago last July. Been looking for a good Italian beef sandwich place, like Johnnie's in Elmwood Park or Al's Beef since the move and finally found it in Guido's Chicago Deli. Plenty of beef, good peppers and onions on a toasted bun. Delicious! If we could only get Gonella Bread/rolls out here it would be Perfecto. Try it, you'll like it.

xEsnG4T-OwsBGHlxXd0Y4w.text: DELICIOUS food -- slower service, but the food is FRESH! All these complaints about service -- I just don't see it. Yes, they are crowed; yes, it takes awhile for the food -- it's FRESH! You aren't going to a fast food restaurant.   Chicago, Taylor Street environment. LOVE it! So far, we love the meatball sandwich; broasted chicken; Tamales around the holidays; Tiramisu; Roast beef; Italian sausage. All come highly recommended!

tk_DRpLuX0_qXsvWZ9V2kA.text: Good food family atmosphere.  Lots to chose from on the menu Been here 2 time always good

aEZBIX-r1AEq8WITKV1bSw.text: Really, really, really good pizza!! We got pepperoni, sausage, and mushrooms. The crust and the sauce were SO good. We will definitely be coming back! Friendly service too.

kwvB27fzqxSQoJjY0zMlXw.text: Went here last night for the first time. The interior is set up in a way that made me confused as to what to do upon entering. Do I find a seat, do I wait at the door where the menu stand is, do I approach the register/counter?  However, the food was phenomenal. I ordered the fried mozzarella cheese sticks, and they were very delicious with a thick-battered crust. The basil and the flavor of the marinara sauce were nice additions. I also had a pepperoni, sausage, and cheese calzone, which in my opinion was one of the better calzones I've had. Not too bready. Get ranch with it because their ranch is also very tasty. I'll be back.

kdO-lUQ3avKebWJMdiiYWQ.text: Really great place to eat! My boyfriend comes here pretty often and recently has been raving about an off the menu sandwich. It's a caprese sandwich with eggplant parmesan. It has fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, basil, balsamic and thin crispy eggplant parmesan on a baguette. You must try! This was so amazing I'm still thinking about it. It's a huge sandwich so you'll definitely want to split it. I'll be back for more of this and to try their canolis!

5yQLNVCnJ4-onF8D415RGg.text: Great food almost as good as eating in Rome. Really great eggplant parmigean. Good veal parm, too. Decent bread and a truly acceptable salad. BUT, the service sucked. Forget the slowness, but ignoring? And picking up dirty napkins and silverware and then serving food without washing. That's seriously wrong. Still, good food and large servings make this a place worth revisiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pqHnx4Ab1JdhqZqxNlcEgQ.text: Got to Scottsdale after a long flight and we were all clearly hangry. After searching for different places in the area we all agreed on Guido's. Now let me tell you I come from an Italian/ Sicilian family that is very picky about our food and Guidos food was spectacular!! From the atmosphere, service, to the quality of the food everything was amazing and it was priced reasonably! If you're in the area I would recommend that you check this place out.

pCOaoayoW3LAtkdF3K76ew.text: Tried this place for lunch this past Friday.  Gotta say it was pretty good!  I ordered the full Caprese Sandwich (takeout) - it was great!  I was also pretty impressed at how quickly they made my takeout order given the crowd in there.    I'd recommend calling ahead to place takeout orders to avoid waits.  Another pro tip:  the large menu above the grill doesn't have all of their items listed so, go to the cashier and grab a paper menu - it has everything on it.  Verdict:  highly recommend.  I'll definitely be back.

M9ULXQG6i5gsvjj7_1hkIw.text: Big fan of this place. Always went south of town to DeFelco's but I honestly believe this place is better. Freshest sandwich in the valley in my opinion.

YDXr7zSf_j-XJ4hue5omew.text: Food here is so good. I've tried a variety of things including the meatball and sausage sandwich. My favorites are the calzones and the grilled chicken sandwich. If you haven't been yet, try it and you'll soon be a regular

HG5OUnzvj_51aP5eR8DDuA.text: Just the worst. Owner was ranting in the back and humiliating his staff. So nasty and so rude.

tg1LXM2tDU-wv4aJdoEFlA.text: Just arrived from the Scottsdale mall at around 7pm sat.  The place had one booth and one table taken. We took a booth. It was a first visit, we announced it and we're welcomed. We ordered a sausage and peppers large sandwich and an eggplant large sandwich with 2 sodas. We got up and walked around to see all of the items they sold in the rest of the store. . While the restaurant section menu prices are more in line to being reasonable a large homemade excellent fresh made sausage is $5.99 a lb. about 3/4 of one sausage. You decide. Our sausage and peppers hero was excellent and the toasted bread perfectly crunchy and the red sauce just right. The price was excellent for the large sandwich.. The eggplant sandwich was also excellent. We took home a meat ball sandwich which was very nice but not as good as Casanova Brothers sandwiches in GILBERT. They are #1. I definitely give GUIDOS #2 and when in SCOTTSDALE mall it's a short ride to Shea Blvd for some delicious sandwiches at reasonable prices. 3 large sandwiches a coke and ginger ale plus tax $41.00 and we had enough for a 2nd dinner the next night and a half  and a little more! Very nice atmosphere and Maria was a pleasant server!

aQP68thoJI-8q8YGHsnxkw.text: Flew to AZ for a conference and found Guido's on several searches.  It was close (6 miles) from my hotel.  After flying all night and morning I was starving and found the shopping center Guido's was located in and went right in.  Old school Italian deli I have encountered on my mainland trips and was very happy.  Starving I ordered a half Chicago special with Italian beef and sausage, a whole Italian combo and a Greek salad to go.  Ran over to Safeway next door to get a six pack of craft beer.  Got back to the hotel and had a feast.  The next day I was planning on eating with some folks but fell through.  Tried to get a reservation on my own, but too late to book any thing and landed up at Guido's again.  Had the Veal Piccata, a small Guido's combo pizza and some desert cookies.  Back to the hotel to polish off the meal with the left over beer.  Fantastic, nothing like it here in Hawaii.  Two days later, leaving for the airport, I swung by to pick up two sandwiches for the long flights back to Honolulu and cookies for my family.  Sandwiches were the Italian combo and the cappicola/salami.  Great homemade Italian cookies, also.  All in all, no better place to find Italian food.  Real old school and family run to boot.  Owner, Joe Guido is there all the time I was there and is a really friendly to all his customers, new and old.

Sf6GKQWCcAYPOeQuC8z3cQ.text: This place used to be wonderful, but they have seriously gone down hill in the past year. Management, service, and cleanliness are terrible. Stay away...

IIgf-wrSp3fXFT5rvPfWWA.text: Mediocre Italian, at best. Seems like the place needs a facelift and new management.  Owner was rude.

vhx7Q3b-Y-1UTmlrPiHrQg.text: Didn't feel like cooking Sunday night. The assembled horde were hungry. Decided to order Italian and have it delivered from Guido's. Then, later that week, we all wanted to watch the CWS-NYY game and I had a hankering for eggplant parmigiana  Sunday, we ordered a margharita pizza, sausage pizza, garlic bread w melted mozzarella and marinara and cheesecake for all. The second time, we ordered eggplant parmigiana, antipasto, fried calamari w marinara, a couple of subs and cheesecake for all.  Okay, for starters, I understand that any restaurant-delivered food is not gonna be as fresh as it would be in their dining room. That said, the food from Guido's was pretty good on that score. The delivered food was reasonably warm or reasonably cold depending on the item. The spaghetti accompanying the eggplant was al dente.  Other than the calamari -- it was over-breaded, soft and overdone -- everyone was delighted with their dinner. Except me. But, that's what I get for ordering seafood in Arizona. The pizzas were warm, but a little light on the sausage topping.   The cheesecake was especially good, a nice-sized portion, reminiscent of NY cheesecake. The filling was creamy without being too heavy. Guido's cheesecake has a very thin graham cracker crust.   Be warned: there is an 18% service charge for orders delivered. If this food was served in their dining room, I'd knock them down a star. But, as for delivered pizza/italian food, this is about as good as it gets.

sWv-ES0zi6S8u5vBQgFVcw.text: A splendid Italian deli in Scottsdale.  I frequented Guido's when I lived down the street in Scottsdale.  The food is invariably fresh and tasty.    The grocery selection of italian staples is fantastic.

Xmu9oMRUHrJIQO85IhtqTg.text: My fiance and I went here for lunch today.  The service was quick the waitress was very sweet and friendly.  I ordered the meatball sub and my fiance had the grilled chicken salad.  The bread on my sub was delicious and the meatball had great flavor!  I love that their sauce is slightly sweet and the fresh basil on top was a great touch.  His chicken salad was great as well! They sell so many delicious treats and Italian packaged foods, as well.  We will definitely be back!

Y1zdiEM1KQLzeWfqABuu6w.text: Came in for a sandwich and found myself getting an AMAZING toasted italian sub with a side salad. Absolutely outstanding.  The person at the counter was friendly and informative, and helped with suggestions. They have an amazing menu of Italian cuisine, and they also have frozen, fresh and Italian product market items you can purchase to take home. I truly recommend them if you are around Shea and Scottsdale road for a great lunch or dinner!

AgI9_PSfdgClpLaM0-TzHA.text: The food here is really good, but I miss the casual old neighborhood place.  I used to stop in for quick sandwiches all the time -- you'd walk up to the counter, order a sandwich to go, and the very efficient guys behind the counter would have you walking out with a great sub in just a few minutes.  For the last year, though, it's table service.  Same good food, but slower and more expensive.  An Italian sub (no side) and a coke is now $14 with a 20% tip. Sure it's good, but that's not something I'm going to do every day.

M-KDzDbzqJEM6iA0fEyBLw.text: My second place for amazing sandwiches. Their Hot Pastrami is out of this world the best I have ever had.  Its a great store and restaurant with great food I recommend the Italian Sausage and meatball subs as well. if you are in the neighborhood stop by you will not be sorry.

ob57Jb1ALlpgYaubBbJ3HA.text: This place is a hidden gem! It's been in AZ since 1980 and I only learned of it within the last few years. It's a combination of italian deli and sit-down restaurant. Surprisingly, the pizza wasn't very good, but they offer broasted chicken and broasted fish with broasted potato wedges or broasted fries and it is amazingly and consistently delicious. We drive from Glendale to eat here and then drive back home - it is so worth it. We've had broasted chicken at other places but we've never seen anyone else offer broasted fish. It's like thick nuggets of cod in a light batter and it is so good (comes with coleslaw, chicken meal comes with salad or coleslaw).  They serve you hot garlic bread in a basket that is often made from Italian bread, French bread and even a sesame French bread, baked on premises!  We've never had to wait to be seated and its one reason my wife and I do NOT like to go out to eat on a Friday or Saturday night in the Phoenix metropolitan area, where dine-in restaurants commonly have a  1-2 hour wait before getting a table (Grimaldi's, Texas Roadhouse, Applebees, Olive Garden, Red Lobster, Cheesecake Factory, etc...etc...)  They also sell dry pastas, sauces and oils imported from Italy as well as offer a variety of fresh baked goods, I also like that I can pick up the latest copy of the free New Times newspaper there.  The pasta dishes are excellent. The only thing we've had they we were disappointed with is the pizza - which is kind of shocking, given how good everything else is and how authentically Italian it is otherwise.  Haven't tried anything from the deli. We go there primarily for the broasted fish and broasted chicken. You have to try both and decide which you like better (most people I take prefer the fish, but agree they are both great!).  Prices are very reasonable and lots of menu items to select from. And they serve Coke products. What more could I ask for?

DOCKmgnK1m3sCQ6EqIjrTw.text: Homemade pasta and sauce!  The sausage (also made there) is amazing.  I've been here quite a few times, and have introduced other folks to the place.  Great for takeout, and if you get there early enough, you can dine on premises.  It has a Chicago feel to it, and reminds me of an old Italian grocery I used to frequent.

aOmhNJkyAUOsraxSGrUlvw.text: I just plain love Guido's. There's something almost magical about the glow of Christmas lights in the window, the arrangement of black and white memorabilia photos on the walls and the deli/market layout. My other half is from Chicago and last night he was in food heaven. He had the gnocchi and I had the mostaccioli -- yum and yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Welcome home.

yvr1TRh-5ii9YFUScntwVQ.text: This place is a gem.  One of the best sandwiches in Scottsdale, and they truly make you feel at home here.  I try to stop by at least once a month for something over here.   Great for an affordable meal or for some fresh deli when you don't want to cook.

MG4u2tydT7tyU7XD6S8rmg.text: I love this place! I eat here all the time on my lunch break, and the food is absolutely amazing. Also, the staff is so friendly and knowledgable about everything. I love the history and the family style of this place. I will continue to be a regular.

faxHiFWydbY8FH2d83UAmA.text: I went to this gem of a place today for lunch with my aunt and niece,they had been there before but I had not.  I had a great sandwich called a prosciutto caprese, it had fresh mozzarella and basil on it and the bread was divine.  The whole sandwich with the tomatoes and oil combined with the fresh bread,prosciutto cut perfectly, homemade  (I'm guessing) mozzarella, served with broasted fries is on my top ten sandwiches I've ever had.  My aunt had an Italian sub that was delicious as well, but even she liked mine better. My niece got a little bowl of spaghetti which she loved almost as much as the chocolate cake we shared after.  It's a great environment,with real italian products for sale, deli items, baked goods, canolis that we took home are great too.  However, there was a bald man who may have been the manager or owner that was barking orders to his employees rather rudely it seemed. Also the air conditioning must have been broken because I was sweltering,  so was everyone else there.  It was hard to enjoy the experience when we were sweating the whole time. The waitress was great, I think her name was Jane, i know it began with a 'J' and she had long brown hair and big beautiful brown eyes, and a great smile. She was busy but still had time to be friendly,even when the guys were ringing a bell while she was talking (very disturbing ) she got all of our orders right, got the food out fast, and recommended the Caprese when I asked her about the best sandwiches they had.         So besides the air conditioning being out or not set low enough I would go back to this place, but I'd  rather order to go instead of sweating in there.  I'd like to try the chicken,it looked great.

NKkpqvG9xIRMg9ID6BTrGA.text: The Broached Chicken potato  wedges was some of the best I've ever eaten anywhere. The service was remarkable. The prices are also very reasonable.

vYQXqiKEGqCmycFslc5kzw.text: We've been twice. The first time was a pop in since we'd been intrigued by the name. We are a family of four with two younger kids. The second time, we took my parents. We loved it. My son ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. Loved the sauce and meatballs. The pasta was fresh. I ordered salad both times. Fresh and the chicken add was amazing. My husband ordered the meatball sub. Delish!  When my parents came, they ordered the pastrami sub and the sausage subs. Commented in the amazing bread and meats. They want to go back!  Last thing- soups are to die for!  On service, both times we went early lunch. Our waitress was accommodating, sweet and fast. In seeing other reviews on service, I would recommend going early lunch or early dinner to beat the rush.   I would and have recommend Guidos many times.

bqR5v51tX6kRo6RU3SuB-A.text: Excellent place. Nice and quiet. We have dined here  three times now and it never disappoints.

2rDMzoZERtBW2GKQWZqE5A.text: Love this place.  The breasted chicken is the best.  The servers are always friendly.  Makes for an easy dinner during the week.

KXlKgUqzFj9JDoIQQAlIKw.text: Drove to this place from Litchfield Park 1 1/2 hr round trip good prices and great food made it worth it. As soon as you walk thru the door you feel like you've been sent through some sort of time warp back to Old Time Chicago. From the Deli style counters to the booths for dining in this is a great date spot. The staff was helpful and friendly which made me feel very welcome and at home.  The only negative because well nothing is perfect is that no one welcomed us as we came in and it was mildly awkward figuring out where to place a take out order. Yet that still dims in comparison to my experience. Shout out to @Fox10 news you hit it out of the park with this recommendation!

OQgVAC0vWzj0OikE3YERZg.text: Great food and service. Nice quaint family dining atmosphere. Generous portions of food.

0E36Hx9Skh-puVFLs5Z8og.text: How authentic of a Chicago place is Guido's? Well, they have Old Style beer in the Frig! Guido's is really a Chicago Italian deli, that doubles as sandwich and pasta place. The food is good, but where they excel are with items from their deli case. Take for instance the italian sausage. It's home made and delicious. Really! You should come here just to order it for lunch, or to take a roll of it home for cooking. As we were waiting for our dinner order to arrive, I decided to walk around the store. The specialty salads looked amazing. If I hadn't already ordered, the calamari salad really looked good. I don't know how it tastes, but I made a mental note to come back for lunch and try it. They also have a wide selection of non deli items, but the prices can be high. The San Marzano brand of Marinara pasta sauces was marked $12.99 on a dusty jar. The same sauce at Whole Foods is $8.75. That 12 oz can of Old Style I mentioned above? Well, it was $4.00. I could go on, but you can see where I am going. Competition can be a wonderful thing, Guido's reminds me very much of DeFalco's further down Scottsdale Road and south of Old Town. If you live north of here, then Guido's is a viable alternative. yelp.com/biz/defalcos-it... For dinner we ordered the Chicken Parmesan and bowl of Angel Hair with sausage and meatballs. Both came with a house salad. The marinara sauce was good, but somewhat bland, without the taste of any garlic or oregano. Along with two Ice Teas, our meal ran us $35.90 including taxes, but before gratuities. Guido's is Three Stars, "A-OK".

CdDDOvzsitWVJnPDyGvMKA.text: Worst service ever over a half an hour to even order. If you come here get it to go! The food itself is good but they always seem to mess up our orders I really cant give more than 3 stars. Also wish their meatballs were all beef, but their sauce and sandwiches are amazing.

nLPos3hP9haUCMtiVzaGiQ.text: Okay place. Was better back in the day. Itallian deli, store restaurant. Food was descent... service and friendliness not so great. Expensive for mediocre service. They were better back in the day when cared about being the best at food and friendly  service..not so much now...sad, not a go to place anymore.

RRWt1A2Rlq6SVbw0ZFIJIA.text: We died and wet to Italian deli heaven!  The Chicago combo was fantastic. Sadly the fish and other meets are cross contaminated, so my Father had to be careful with what he chose. Otter then that, fantastic!

axiq4ZFv_KSpX0No_g_5xQ.text: I always over order when I come to Guido's.  It's just so hard to make a decision.  Their sandwiches are HUUUUGE.  My favorite is the proscuitto caprese sandwhich, which is just stuffed with proscuitto.  All of their pastas are great as well and I can't ever seem to leave without ordering calamari.  Quite the little gem of the neighborhood!

DKDrUzSmlrHC8CmrWXm3Fw.text: My grandparents came over from Sicily so I know Italian and this is really good.  Not only is their dining choices excellent but I love their made in store delicious Italian sausage, both sweet and hot to choose from. I like them both. They have the best pepperoni that I can find anywhere. I have to buy extra to freeze and bring in my suitcase to my sister!!!! My husband eats a big chunk in front of the tv. Their Italian beef and Dip is delicious to take home also.We have eaten their delicious spaghetti and meat balls, but our recent favorite is to share the "howie's pastrami" sandwich which is on a huge roll, lots of delicious, lean pastrami and topped with lots of coleslaw. It is messy, but soooo good. I know pastrami doesn't sound Italian, but it is delicious.We also share a 1/2 order of fries. Trust me you will be stuffed.  They also have broasted chicken that looks great, but I love everything else so much I haven't tried it.

Dg-SJY9L9dK1JiEXCT8VGA.text: This was excellent. I've lived in the area for 7 years and never stopped in, now I'm regretting it! I know it's Chicago but it reminded my husband of the places they'd eat at in Little Italy in NYC when he was growing up. I had the antipasto salad, I have not been able to find one like this in the Phoenix area since I left NY. Loved it! We'll be back!

Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Antipasto salad!

-HvQX42QMQgl0IGC_-Sx_g.text: Very hard to score guidos this low since we have always loved the best broasted chicken and sandwiches. But after watching an episode of check please, we decided to try other menu items. We ordered the linguine and clams and veal piccata which came with a side plate of spaghetti and red sauce. Both dishes came out looking like soup. Pasta was overcooked and drenched in liquid and grease. Veal came in the same manner, drenched in sauce although tastier than the pasta, but 1/4 inch of liquid is too much for any dish that is not soup.  I love your deli, subs, chicken, even pizza but i was extremely disappointed with the pasta which should be the staple of any Italian cooking. If this was my first experience at guidos i would never go back. I will still go to guidos but never for anything but the broasted chicken or sandwiches

Nt9Nae0_w9ufPC4u-f-YMw.text: This is the best deli around. For starters, they serve Boars Head. I love this place for lunch and dinner. I would recommend the Minestrone soup,chicken parmesan and fries as they are heavenly!!

4mmsYCdMY_ZpZmQhWXft6g.text: If you love mayonnaise, this is your kind of place.  Ordered the chicken salad sandwich to-go, first of all, they didn't ask what size I wanted and they gave me a foot-long (way too big), then, there was so much mayonnaise on it that it was inedible.  So, $14 for a sandwich that I couldn't choke down. Besides the mayonnaise, not much flavor.  Never going back! Prices for sandwiches are ridiculous.

0aTdOVBH8HfQ9jJT6FcG3Q.text: I went there for lunch given the good review it received from the pbs show "check please". I had angle hair which was good but not great.  I was surprised they charged me again for a Coke refill. Not many places are that "economical". Too bad, I was hoping for a good Italian lunch place.

bGrwrW33gjBBoxbUV6S8gQ.text: Good, solid traditional Italian food in comfortable unpretentious atmosphere. A place you can eat twice a week. Def worth a try. Good dessert also  and generally friendly service

c-3MXoY3dxK9QEag80BZ2Q.text: Coming from the NJ/NY area I was pretty skeptical about a deli in a strip mall but this place really came through. It reminded me of a pizza place back home that hasn't been updated since the 90s but doesn't matter since the food is on point. I got the italian sandwich, would've liked more meat but it was good. I will definitely become a regular here.   Oh, and if you complained about the service, did you really expect 5 star service at a deli? Get off your "foodie" high horse.

ngE7oO9KnvYUXKexVyfaxw.text: Food is hit and miss, and the service is always miss. My first visit I went with a friend and they messed up my order. Not a big deal as they fixed it and brought me a new one. I thought the chicken sandwich was good. My friend had the meatball sandwich which they really enjoyed.  I went back a second time with family and the service was seriously some of the worst I've ever dealt with in any dining experience. There were 4 of us - 2 of us were served the wrong meals, drinks were brought out very late (they forgot one drink), and the gnocchi were pretty bad (I thought it was funny how the chef came out and pulled a packet of gnocchi that was for sale off the shelf right in front of us right after we ordered). We were the only people in the restaurant at the time so we knew it was coming to us.  Besides getting the orders mixed up, the server would ask one person what they wanted, go to the next person, and then go back to the previous person to confirm what they ordered. He had a pad of paper in his hand so I'm not sure if he was writing down our order or doodling.

cPOvwHu7AVTRJl-vGlBMjw.text: Very good Italian food, friendly service, a bit expensive but fresh food, lots of variety, and I'd recommend  it!!

pYPIe2CzVos3xeQpzc9ofw.text: OMG! Why haven't we been here sooner? Great Chicago style deli and food and I'm from Chicago so I should know. The Italian beef is better than Portillos beef and the homemade Italian sausage flavor was perfect. Our group tried the broasted chicken, the daily calzone special and the combo sandwich. Pricing was very reasonable and the menu selection huge. I look forward to trying some of the deli products to take home for dinner. Thank goodness for google maps that have led us to Guidos.

6EaW8Wkhwg-VUmXKOvRSYw.text: Awesome atmosphere and great food. The broasted French fries were amazing and the Italian sub and chicken Parmesan sub were both great too. Definitely will be back and will try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Broasted potato wedges &amp; half of an Italian sub.

kgNA7QL3Z52z9gRElv-UjQ.text: When you walk in, the smell of awesome Italian food is almost enough to induce drooling! Can't tell you how much I enjoyed lunch here yesterday. We were a group of 4, and found a table immediately. The server (Maria) was reasonably fast given how busy the place was, and. although it took a while to arrive, the food was out of this world!  Finding an Italian restaurant that serves low carb food is almost impossible, but Guido's actually has more than one item on the menu that I could eat without substitutions ... and they were unbelievably tasty. To top it all off, since I'm a pretty handy cook myself, I'm forever wishing I had my spice rack with me when I eat out - this is the first time I haven't thought that in ages! Give it a try, and be willing to take your time. Food this good isn't instant!

-KQp69bdbieHOFoMdEK0IA.text: Wow I was just passing through town and this little deli looked like a good place to grab a bite to eat.   Looks can be deceiving because when i got inside this was basically a full-service restaurant, deli, and then some.   Food took a while to come out but it was a busy night and I could see that they really cook everything homestyle and to order. It was definitely worth the wait.  I ordered the chicken parmesan sandwich which was hot and delicious, the sauce and uality of the food gives me confidence to come back and sample the whole menu.

P3-WDuUctgav1wwX_P1OWg.text: Ordered takeout pizza.   And it was Awful.   Called to discuss.  Got a lecture.        Going to miss your broasted chicken a lot because I'm not interested in a lecture.   Way too many other choices.

tyhE2xUitBDIEMQe9IxMsA.text: My husband and I came for takeout after seeing Guidos on Check Please Arizona.  Cute little place.  We placed our order and somehow it never got to the chef/cook.  After waiting at least 45 minutes and several attempts by the manager to resubmit our order, we finally received our order (without any apology).  Customer service not so great!  I ordered the veal parmesan...nothing special, and the same for my husband's Bolognese.  We will not be back.  There are so many great restaurants in Scottsdale that care about their customers.

nP4Vj_MMEiTL2zKE0KqVAw.text: Guido's is a little ethnic restaurant in a strip mall. It has a real Chicago feel, but the food is less than expected. I ordered linguini with clam sauce. The clams were not fresh. They were minced canned clams. The pasta was cooked a proper al dente but under seasoned. A little garlic would have gone a long way to making it a better dish. One of our guests got the broasted chicken and it was super dry. The raviolis and meatballs were OK, but nothing special. Service was OK. No beers on tap. No cold glasses either. This place would be fine for lunch, but there are a lot better options for an authentic Italian dinner.

hIoBUdEmNl_4gD9DLyaFtg.text: We usually go here for great broasted chicken. My husband loves their pasta. Their sausage is homemade and delicious. Not much ambience, kinda noisy but it feels like being in New York in one if those Italian Deli markets. Great service! Always worth another visit.

XVj3V6Xkzdcch226YLDl6w.text: Solid 5 stars the first 20 or so time i visited but it has been 4 and even 3s the past few times I went. Hope it's not a trend and they go back up to 5.  I usually order the eggplant parm either with pasta or a sandwich depending on my mood. Delicious even though lately it seems they been skimping on the cheese. Also a different bread every time so you never know which one you are getting--some breads I like better than others. I also tried the calzones, lasagna, diavalo, and the clam sauce. All delicious.  Service is usually good. Maria is one of the best waitress there and always a 5 star for service when she the waitress. Another woman with long brown hair is usually a 3 star when we get her.  I'll be back. Hope it goes back to 5 stars.

VaEy9Hwi4LGudW6rxrxUXw.text: Great Italian food and market. Quite the variety of foods there is something for everyone. Wait staff was great and very attentive. I would go there again

1OlGaI9JC5nYWp4Etm5F9g.text: Best place in Phoenix for Italian groceries and food.  Excellent menu for dining at the store!!!

Qm6AuKVxbNzLnkCn5JuGYQ.text: Guido's is my new favorite spot. It has a lot of character and great decorations. The food is amazing. I will most likely be here two or three times a week. The servers are friendly and helpful. Overall this is a must if you like good Italian food. I can't wait to try everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sausage sandwich, delicious! Great red sauce! The roll is nice and toasted.
Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Italian sub. Delicious! Capicola, mortadella, salami and provolone. The bread is nice and soft.

Jbk0-ttAW5sQ_7DFuPo6zw.text: My first time at this establishment and it is by far the best experience I have ever had. I ordered the pastrami since it is usually my go-to and now EVERY pastrami I have had till now has been outclassed on every level possible. Everything about this place is amazing. The food. The atmosphere. The service. My drink cup was never empty. Which usually is a nuisance. But not at this place. It was a blessing. One of the key factors of why this place is amazing is due to the fact that it is ALSO a little Italian shop where you can get everything you need to try and recreate whatever you eat from the kitchen. WHAT?! Definitely recommending this place to EVERYONE I know!

cJYf7pnXeuaWyrMce2lD6A.text: Great! While visiting had 2 takeout meals that we really enjoyed! The atmosphere was great and could definitely  see eating at the deli as well!

o8mfU5Tb0vYJY0kf2-vmww.text: This place is fantastic! The food is out of this world & the staff treat you like family. I ate the lasagna, side salad w/bread twice in the two weeks and was not disappointed. I considered posting a picture of my food but that's the last thing I'm thinking about when it hits the table.

MyWUGCJ475QTBSbiyb2XHw.text: Great food, great prices. Dine in or get take out. Always consistent. We love this place. There are also healthy options.

dz0Wk1BihImd3zBuz07iaQ.text: This has been a great spot for years. Great sandwiches and pasta dishes.  It's a store to with greasy made pastas and salads. Where else in Scottsdale can you buy Old Style beer!?!  They always have sausage with peppers and onions and lasagna ready to go.

vI0SsidgmI3Zs2ZHjpSQaA.text: Outstanding neighborhood deli and dining. Friendly and attentive service with great food priced right. Try it and you'll add it to your list of favorites.

WPM299d66E2PhTCImRAZ_w.text: My favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. Every time I pass through Phoenix, I have to go here to pick up some cookies and pastas, and also get lunch. My family and I love the margarita pizza, really any of their pizzas are good. I love spaghetti and meatballs, and their meatballs are fantastic. Their sandwiches are amazing, and their ricotta cheesecake is the best in the world. Service is friendly, and the environment is really cute and has an authentic Chicago/Italian market vibe. They have all kinds of cool things in the market, like authentic Italian products (I.e. Coffee soda--so good). Go to Guido's!

photos.caption: Photo of Guido's Chicago Meat & Deli - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs, Meat Lover&#39;s Special

zXIJzyt1DUcmvUXoJlD6Sg.text: This place is pretty good. I had the fried chicken dinner. Although it was very, very dry and I'll probably never get it again, I did see items in the menu that I would love to get my hands on. In the future when I go back (because I do plan to go back) I'll be able to give this spot another review and hopefully I'll be able to bring those stars a bit higher. I probably would have given this place at least 4 stars had my chicken not had the texture of rubber. It was so dried out that I thought I just bit into a piece of chicken jerky. So for now I'll leave my review as it is until I revisit. I will add this, the customer service was great! Our waitress was awesome with a great sense of humor, something I definitely look forward to on my next visit.
